What she likes most about her job is taking care of her plants, and she's very happy when she sees them big and with very good results.

She has been doing this work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the heavy bags of her harvests to the distribution centers located an hour from her community, where she receives better prices for her beans.

With the loan she received she's going to hire day laborers to help her with the maintenance of her plants as well as with the pruning and weeding.  With the 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help her.

This is her second loan.  She's grateful to the lenders for their trust.  She's also grateful to the members of her communal bank for their moral support, and this way she'll continue with her work plans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun is 20 years old and a responsible mother of a young child. She currently resides in the Kompong Cham province. She operates a few plots of farm as the primary source of her income. Her husband always devotes his time to her in order to yield a better rice production every harvest season. She has been in this business since she was a child. She earns approximately 6,000 KHR per day. 

Choeun dreams of having a better life and achieving financial stability. That is why she is seeking ways to support her family. Choeun plans to invest her generated income into a grocery-selling business. However, she needs additional capital to make this possible. For this reason, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to purchase grocery items such as spices, snack foods, sweets, powders, shampoos, beverages and other miscellaneous household items for selling in her store. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her new business in order to provide her family with a better quality of life, especially her lovely child. She will send her to a good school to get a higher education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as spices, snack foods, sweets, powders, shampoos, beverages and other miscellaneous household items for selling in her store.

loans.name: Habiza

texts.ru: Хабиза очень трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 15 лет назад она начала свой бизнес с изготовлением и реализации лепешки. Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. В течении дня она производит 200-260 штук лепешки по стоимости 1 сомони за штук. Ее старшая дочь помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони  для покупки муки для изготовления лепешки. Она ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, ей поможем обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами!
texts.en: Habiza is a very hardworking and honest woman.  She is 40 years old and raising four children.  To provide the family with all of the necessities, she started her own business of preparing and selling flatbread 15 years ago.  Her efficiency helps her to be successful in the business.  Habiza makes 200-260 flatbread per day at a cost of one somoni each.  Her oldest daughter helps her with running the business.  Habiza is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase flour for making flatbread.  She relies on your kindness.  Let's help her to provide her family with all of the necessities!

loans.use: to purchase flour for making flatbread

loans.name: Senam Group

texts.en:
The 'Senam' group comprises two women who sell fish and maize (corn) oil in Teshie. They buy these items from a central market and sell them to customers in the community.

Senam sells fish and maize (corn) oil in large quantities. Her customers are based in Teshie. She supplies the items to her customers and collects full payment in two days' time. She is 38 years old and married to a driver; they have three children. 

This is her second loan with ID-Ghana. She is requesting 500 GHS. She was given 300 GHS in the first loan cycle and completed payment on Aug. 15, 2012. She has reinvested the profits so her business can grow quickly.

They need 700 GHS to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy fish and maize (corn) oil in large quantities to sell to customers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 33 años de edad; vive con su pareja y su hija en la casa que compró gracias al empeño de su trabajo cotidiano. Daniel, es un hombre de lucro; se dedica a la venta de comestibles (arroz, verduras, pollo, carne, conservas, etc.); esta labor ejerce en su propio hogar hace 05 años y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Daniel comenta que para obtener su negocio tuvo muchas dificultades, ya que no tenia ingreso económico; pero al pasar del tiempo con las ventas de su cosecha de café, logro incrementar su tienda y sobre todo desde que empezó a contar con los préstamos que MFP y los financieros brinda; ahora s hace conocedor de su actividad, atendiendo con amabilidad a sus clientes. Ahora con el préstamo que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de comestibles para su tienda, ya que es su trabajo principal donde le genera buenos ingresos. Este es su crédito número 03 y una vez mas agradece el apoyo de los financieros, quienes confían de su capacidad de pago. En su banco comunal, le agrada trabajar con socios solidarios y cabales.
Con el préstamo de 2,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de saco de arroz, pollo, verduras. Entre lo necesario para su tienda.
texts.en:
Daniel, 33, lives with his partner and daughter in the house he bought thanks to his determination in his everyday job. 

Daniel is a profit-oriented man. He makes a living selling foodstuffs (rice, vegetables, chicken, meat, canned food, and other things). He has worked in this field for 5 years and always has the help of his wife. 

Daniel says that in order to get his business, he had many difficulties because he did not have any income. However, over time, selling his coffee plants and, above all, the loans that MFP and its donors offered , he was able to grow his store. 

Currently he is an expert in his business, attending amicably to his clientele. 

With the loan he obtained, he will invest it in the inventory for his store because it is his primary source of revenue. 

This is his third loan and once again he is thankful for the support of financiers who believe in his ability of repayment. At his communal bank, he enjoys working with such supportive and fine colleagues. 

With the loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, he will stock up on sacks of rice, chicken, and vegetables, among other necessary items for his store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, chicken, vegetables, and other things for his store.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim is 37 years old and a married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She aspires to the development of her farming business because she wants to offer a good standard of living to her family. She cultivates rice on a few pieces of farmland she received as her inheritance from her ancestors. She is thankful for her business that allows her to manage daily commodities and food allowances which are quickly consumed. She is married to her a noble man who is currently engaged in construction business. Together, they have given birth to a small kid.

Chim’s husband would like to work in the neighboring country in order to raise more income and upgrade their quality of life. He realized that he could get a higher payment if he goes and works there. Due to the shortage of funds, Chim is requesting a loan in the amount of 350 USD, which will be used by her husband to pay for a passport and other documents & fees. They hope to secure the overall welfare of the family and someday experience financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for a passport and other documents & fees.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
Demetria de 31 años, es una mujer amable, sencilla y sobre todo laboriosa: vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposo Aurelio de 32 años; en ella reside con su querido hijo Jack de 11 años, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Hace 02 años, Demetria abrió una tienda de comestibles y es una de las más concurridas por la gente de su comunidad; gracias a su amabilidad de atención al cliente, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano.
Le gusta su trabajo, ya que gracias a la visita que tiene de sus vecinos, tiene siempre un ingreso económico. Demetria invertirá su préstamo en la compra de provisiones necesarias para su puesto de ventas. Este es su crédito número 02, agradece por la confianza que le brindan, ya que así seguirá con su negocio; por otra parte se siente alegre de formar parte de su banco comunal, ya que trabaja con socios dinámicos y comprometidos. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de un saco de arroz, bebidas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Demetria, 31, is a pleasant, modest, and above all industrious woman.  She lives in the house she bought with her husband Aurelio, 32.  She lives there with her beloved son Jack, 11, whom she wants to give a better future.

Two years ago Demetria opened a grocery store, and it's one of the busiest in her community.  Thanks to her kind customer service she is preferred by her customers, who don't hesitate to begin their shopping very early in the day.  She likes her job because thanks to visits from her neighbors she always has an income.

Demetria will invest her loan in buying the provisions she needs for her store.  With the 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll stock up with a sack of rice and beverages, among other things.

This is her second loan.  She's grateful for the trust given her because that way she'll continue with her business.  She's also happy to be part of her communal bank because she works with dynamic and committed members.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, beverages, and other products

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр  - фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием винограда и клубники.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания винограда на небольшой территории.
Александр приобрел саженцы винограда, капельное орошение для полива и мотоблок для вспашки земли, тем самым облегчая ручной труд.
В планах на будущие:  покупка трактора с навесным оборудованием для обработки и вспашки земельного участка, а также установка теплицы для винограда и клубники.
В личных планах: завершение строительства частного дома.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока и системы капельного орошения.
texts.en: Alexander is a farmer. Since 2010, he has been growing grapes and strawberries. To deal with household chores, he helps his wife. His work began with growing grapes on a small amount of territory. Alexander purchased grapes, drip irrigation for irrigation and a motorized cultivator for tilling the land, thereby making it easier for manual labor. His plans for the future: buying tractors with mounted equipment for processing and plowing the land, as well as the installation of greenhouses for grapes and strawberries. His personal plans: completion of the construction of his private house. He needs your help to finance the motorized equipment and a drip irrigation system.

loans.use: To purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Jatisari 3 Group

texts.en: Muhadjir, 42, is married to Inah and blessed with two children. He lives in Kalisari in the East of Jakarta. Every day Muhadjir sells "Bubur Ayam" near his house. Bubur Ayam is a traditional food from Indonesia that usually eaten in the morning. Bubur Ayam is porridge cooked with coconut milk, pepper, nutmeg, coriander, and chicken slices. He has been in this business for 10 years. Every day he sells in the morning from 6:30 to 9:30 am, and in the afternoon from 2:30 pm - to 7:00 pm. He often faces the problem high rice prices and in rainy season he can't sell Bubur ayam because he can't use his cart. His dream is to have a restaurant and his own house.

loans.use: to buy 4 liters of rice, 4 liters of coconut milk, fish and meat

loans.name: Agostin

texts.en:
Agustin is 46 years old and married with three children, all of whom attend public school. He lives in northern Albania. His family members, unlike some other residents in the same location, are happy living here. Agustin is known by locals for his hard work, personable nature and excellent skills at what he does for a living. 

Agustin loves his job and has been successful at it. Yet, at times, he feels frustrated that he doesn’t have the building materials and other necessary tools to do the job. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy building materials and most importantly a concrete mixer.

Being the only financial provider at home makes Agustin a proud father. At the same time, he is solely responsible for the family's living conditions and nutrition. Agustin promises that he will pay back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a concrete mixer and other building materials for his business.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Responsable y activo, así es el señor Dionisio de 43 años de edad; gracias a su empeño cotidiano obtuvo su propia casa, donde habita con su esposa Irene de 40 años y con sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un buen futuro, mas adelante. Dionisio es un hombre de lucro; se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para “niños, jóvenes y adultos”. Esta labor lo ejerce en su comunidad hace 6 años y siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa; gracias a su amabilidad y dinamismo, los pobladores de su comunidad siempre acuden a su puesto venta, esperando comprar sus prendas. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es ser admirado por la gente de su pueblo, ya que es un hombre que le gusta salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se interponen en su camino; comenta que desde que empezó a obtener créditos en MFP, le ha ido muy bien en su trabajo, ya que no le falta mercadería en su puesto de ventas, es por ello que ahora con el préstamo que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para continuar con su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 09; una vez más agradece por la confianza que le brindan, ya que gracias a los financieros logra seguir con su trabajo. Por otro lado agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por darles la confianza de trabajar con socios íntegros. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles se abastecerá de  prendas de vestir para incrementar en su puesto.
texts.en:
43 year-old Dionisio is an active and responsible man. Thanks to his daily working he obtained his own home, where he lives with his Irene, 40, and his three dear children, for whom he hopes to provide a good future. Dionisio is a man motivated by profit. He works selling garments for "children, young adults, and adults." He has plied this trade in his community for six years and he can always count on the help of his wife, too. Thanks to his kindness and strong presence, other members of the community always come to him in hopes of purchasing their clothes. What he likes most about his work is being admired by people in his town, seeing as he is a man who likes to strive ahead despite the difficulties that he meets on his path. He adds that every since he began getting credits through MFP, things have gone very well for him because he never lacks inventory in his shop. This is his ninth loan, and once again he is grateful for the confidence this brings him, as the finances will allow him to continue with his work. Moreover he would like to thank the members of his community bank for putting their trust in working with its members.
With the 2,000 nuevos soles he will restock his invenotry with new garments.

loans.use: to purchase more garments.

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.ru:
Анжелика – разведена. Она сама воспитывает дочь-подростка, оплачивает ее учебу в вузе. Анжелика зарабатывает на жизнь тем, что торгует детской и подростковой обувью на местном рынке. Она торгует с двух точек, занимается этим бизнесом уже 17 лет. Ее доход составляет около 8 000 гривен.  
Анжелике необходим кредит в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести партию обуви для реализации осенью и зимой. За счет полученных средств Анжелика надеется увеличить свой доход, улучшить условия проживания семьи и дальше развивать свое дело.
texts.en: Anzhelika is divorced with a teenage daughter, for whom she pays university tuition fees.  Anzhelika makes her living by selling shoes for children and teenagers at a local market.  She has two trading stalls and has been in this business for 17 years.  Her income is about 8,000 Hryvnas.  Anzhelika needs a loan of 4,000 Hryvnas to purchase a stock of fall and winter shoes.  On receiving these funds, Anzhelika hopes to increase her income, improve the living situation of her family and to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of shoes for fall and winter.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
The Al-njom group consists of five women  who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The group took out a loan of 155,000 YER.

Aisha is 42 years old and lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is married and has adult children. Aisha is a housewife and has a small house. She requires a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a TV. She hopes to remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy a TV for her house

loans.name: Dar-Alhaid Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dar-Alhaid which comprises of five ladies. They applied for a loan of 190,000 Yemen rials (YER).
 
Sabah lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is 39 years old, is married and has three children. She has worked in embroidery for many years. She is so professional in this field that her goods are required in the market. She started her business with a small amount of capital.

Sabah is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy embroidery threads. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand to other towns to supply embroidered ladies' fabrics.

loans.use: to buy embroidery threads for her business.

loans.name: Komron

texts.ru: Комрон родился 1994 года. В 2001 поступил в школу и в 2012 году успешно окончил. После окончания школы он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Данное время является студентом 1 курса. Он очень способный молодой человек.  Комрон увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу.  Родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университет. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте вместе поможем молодому специалисту окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en: Komron was born in 1994.  He started school in 2001 and successfully completed it in 2012.  After finishing school, he was accepted to the Tajikistan State University.  He is currently a first-year student there.  He is a very capable young man.  Komron likes sports and reads foreign literature in his free time.  His parents cannot pay for his university education.  Komron is requesting this loan to pay for his university education.  He relies on your kindness.  Let's help the young specialist together to graduate from the university and apply his knowledge in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is 48 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his wife Natia. The family sows greens in the open ground and sells them in an open market in Kutaisi, a neighboring town.  In addition, Hamlet owns a milk cow and produces cheese products. He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is what Hamlet earns working as an artisan in the village.  Hamlet requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan programs extend to the country rural poor business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions.  These families do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Hamlet will build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and construct it. Hamlet will sow different kinds of greens and tomatoes to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Hamlet awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Рузибой мужчина в возрасте 59 лет,он пунктуальный,трудолюбивый мужчина.   Женат имеет 3 детей.Обратился в Арванд за поддержкой.   Более 30 лет занимается откормом крупно и мелко рогатого скота, а так же выращивает сельскохозяйственную  культуру.   Рузибой  честным трудом вырастил  своих детей,  построил дом и женил сыновей.  В дальнейшем он хочет помогать своим детям так как у них пока нету работы и их жены тоже домохозяйки. Рузибой хочет чтобы его внуки учились и жили в достатке. На снимке он со своим внуком.   Поэтому хочет расширить свой товарооборот и уровень доходности, хочет приобрести несколько голов скота и надеется на нашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Ruziboy is 59 years old. He is a punctual, hardworking man. He is married and has three children. He has turned to MDO Arvand for support. For more than 30 years he has been involved in raising catlle and small livestock, as well as growing agricultural crops. Through his own honest work, Ruziboy set his children on their feet, built his home, married off his sons.  In the future he wants to support his children as they're currently unemployed and their spouses are housewives. Ruziboy wants his grandchildren to go to school and be prosperous. In the photo he's pictured with one of his grandsons. Thus, he wants to increase his product turnover and income; he would like to buy several head of livestock and is counting on your help and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Loch

texts.en:
Loch is 58 years old, a farmer who has been managing a few pieces of land to make income to feed her family. She has been in this business for more than 20 years, and she gets support from her husband, her good business partner. Their main challenges in the business are pests and flood, which reduce their crop yields each year. This couple is not fortunate to have a baby, so they live a simple life in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Loch would like to have more farmland in order to increase her household income so she can save more money since she and her husband are getting older. Aside from helping Loch at the rice farm, Loch’s husband pursues another business, animal sales, for supplementary profit for his family. 

Loch is requesting financial support amounting to 4,000,000 KHR, which will be used by her husband to purchase animals for trading. Loch realizes that this loan will be great capital for developing their businesses and it will help them earn better profit to satisfy their basic needs. In the future, Loch dreams of having her present house rebuilt to keep her family comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase animals for trading.

loans.name: G.s. 26 De Agosto No 2 Group

texts.es: El G.S. 26 de agosto No. 2 esta conformado por dos integrantes las cuales son: Corina del Carmen, Amparo del Socorro. Ellas  son madres solteras entre las edades comprendidas de 43,47 anos de edad. Con 5 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Corina del Carmen es la cordinadora del grupo su actividad económica  es una  pulpería, nintendo, alquiler de mesas y sillas plásticas) los cual está ubicado en su  casa de habitación. Constan con una experiencia de  12 años .Este grupo solidario ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser responsable y buena paga.  Corina del Carmen con el  financiamiento invertirán en la compra de productos para su  negocio una   pulperia  tienda donde se venden productos al por menor como (una libra de arroz, una cuarta de aceite,  una barra de pan, caja de fósforos entre otros) G.S 26 de Agosto No 2 agradecen a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que les brinda a  personas de escasos recursos para poder tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The August 2nd Solidarity Group #2 consists of two members:  Corina del Carmen and Amparo del Socorro.  They are single mothers who are 43 and 47 years of age respectively.  Between them, they have five children who are under their responsibility.  Corina del Carmen is the coordinator of the group. She sells groceries, offers Nintendo games, and rents out plastic tables and chairs.  She operates her businesses out of her home.  She has 12 years of experience.  

This solidarity group has worked with Fundación León 2000 and demonstrated that they are responsible with their payments.  Corina del Carmen will invest her loan in the purchase products for the grocery store, such as products that are sold in small amounts (a pound of rice, a quart of oil, a loaf of bread, a box of matches, etc.).   

The August 2nd Solidarity Group #2 is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their help and for providing people with limited resources the means to have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and general merchandise.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin, de 28 años, es un joven alegre y trabajador; vive con su pareja Marleny de 25 años y su pequeño hijo, en la casa que sus padres le heredaron. Edwin, es un hombre trabajador, se dedica con mucho esmero a labrar la tierra y luego cultivar plantas de café, que con mucho esfuerzo hace que salgan muy productivas; viene trabajando 12 años y es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el agro. En tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas contrata jornaleros quienes se encargan de acelerar con su trabajo; de sus cultivos obtiene muy buena producción; por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo. 
El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas; pero así el logra seguir perennemente en su trabajo. Con el préstamo que obtuvo comprará plantas de café para cultivarlas en su parcela. Este es su crédito número 06; se compromete seguir aportando sus cuotas puntualmente como en los anteriores créditos y agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por la confianza que le brindan. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de plantas injertos de café para cultivar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Edwin, 28, is a happy and hardworking young man.  He lives with his partner Marleny, 25, and his young child in the house his parents left him.

Edwin is a hardworking man.  He makes a living working the land with a lot of care and then growing coffee plants.  With great effort he makes them grow productive.  He has been working for 12 years and is an expert on the hard work in the farming world.

During the harvest and weeding season he hires day laborers who are responsible for speeding up his work.  He gets a good harvest from his crops and the purchasing businesses give him a very good price per kilogram.

The problem with his work is not being able to fight against the insects that damage the fruit of his plants, but this way he manages to continue perennially in his job.

With the loan he got, 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN], he'll buy grafted coffee plants to grow on his plot of land.

This is his sixth loan.  He pledges to continue making his payments punctually as with the previous loans.  He's grateful to the members of his communal bank for their trust.

loans.use: to buy grafted coffee plants

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухабат сельская женщина, мать шестерых  детей. Занимается откормом скота и продажей молочных изделий собственного производства на местных рынках.   Её изделия пользуются большом спросом, так как они натурального производства. Ее муж  пенсионер, помогает жене за присмотром скота и также занимается куплей-продажей скота на скотном рынке. Кроме своего бизнеса она также занимается вязанием и учит этим своих невесток. Мухаббат сотрудничает  с нашей организацией с 2008года и всегда выгодно использовала полученные  кредиты, после чего намного улучшила свои бытовые условия, за что нас благодарит.    На полученный кредит хочет купить несколько голов скота.  Надеется на дальнейшее взаимовыгодное сотрудничество и поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a country woman, the mother of six children. She is involved in raising livestock and selling dairy products that she herself produces at local markets. Her products are in very high demand because they are natural. Her retired husnband helps her by looking after the livestock and is also involved in buying and selling animals at the livestock market. In addition to her business she is engaged in knitting and teaches her daughters in law.  
Muhabat has been receving credit from MDO Arvand since 2008, and has always put our loans to good use. They have resulted in her greatly improving her standard of living and increased her assets, for which she thanks MDO Arvand. She wants to use this loan to buy several head of livestock. She is counting on your continued cooperation and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Chester Danilo

texts.es: El señor Chester es habitante de Managua pero trabaja en su cultivo de piña en ticuantepe, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta en estos momentos es que no cuenta con capital suficiente para inducir su cultivo y mantener una producción sin plagas, cuenta con el apoyo de su papa ya que su trabajo como guarda de seguridad no le ayuda mucho, su producción la comercializa en los mercados de Managua, actualmente tiene sembrado 1.5 manzanas de piña, el crédito lo requiere para darle el buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y así ofrecer una buena producción de piña a sus clientes.
texts.en: Sr. Chester is a resident of Managua but works on his pineapple crop in the town of Ticuantepe. The greatest difficulty that presents itself at this time is that he doesn't have sufficient capital to start growing his crop and maintain a production free of pests. He has the support of his father as his work as a security guard doesn't help much. His production is sold in the markets of Managua. He has sown 1.5 manzanas [2.6 acres] of pineapple and he needs this loan to provide good maintenance of his crop and in this way offer a good pineapple production to his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng is 43 years old. She is widowed and resides with her mother in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in raising ducks for more than a year, earning approximately $5 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Cheng is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase more ducks to feed in order to produce eggs to sell. This purchase will help her generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her poultry farm and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks to feed in order to produce eggs to sell.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina is 41 years old and married with four children.  Three of them are still attending public schools. They live in northern Albania.  Zina's family, including her parents, siblings and herself, were persecuted by the regime, and they found it very tough living under such circumstances. Yet, in recent years, they have had a much better life with many more opportunities. 

In many families in the region, women are the financial providers for their families, as is Zina.   She has been selling milk and baby calves to the locals and has been making a small income which is enough to live. Now she wants to expand by buying another milk cow with a calf.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan for the first time, hoping that lenders will grant her request.

Zina is confident that she will do well, and her promise to lenders is that she will pay them back on time.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow with a calf

loans.name: Srey Na

texts.en: Srey Na is 20 years old. She is married and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been running a tailoring shop for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $5 each day. Because their present motorbike is old, Srey Na is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase would enable him to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his taxi service.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Наргиза живет с родителями. Она занимается шитьем и вышивкой национальных платьев. В этой области Наргиза два года. Она берет заказы дома. Наргиза просит кредит для покупки тканей, материалов, бисера и ниток.
texts.en: Nargiza lives in Rudaki. She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Nargiza sews and embroiders national dresses, and has been doing this type of work for 2 years. She works out of her home. Nargiza is seeking a loan in order to buy fabric, materials, beads and thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric, materials, beads and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José de 27 años es una joven responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Ana y su hermano Sami al que apoya en su casa que heredó de sus abuelos desde que nació. Estudió mecánica de profesión, pero como su mamá no tiene alguien quien le ayude, él afronta las responsabilidades del negocio de la siembra, solo en temporadas fijas dedica su tiempo al cuidado de sus cultivos de papa, alverja, habas y maíz. Los cuales cosecha gracias a los peones que contrata y los que ayudan a comercializar los frutos al mercado de la ciudad, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Tiene 2 parcelas de terreno agrícola, ello le permite sembrar lo necesario, pero él no desea sembrar lo necesario, por lo contrario espera obtener las facilidades para comprar una parcela más. Ya está juntando dinero, cuenta que en fechas donde no siembra, trabaja en un taller mecánico, donde le pagan una suma considerable de dinero, para poder ahorrar y ayudar a su familia. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Fuerza San lorenzo” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. José, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 15 kilos de semilla de alfalfa y el pago al tractor que volteará la tierra para la siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
José is 27 and is a responsible, young man.  He lives with his mother, Ana, and his brother, Sami, as a source of support in the home he inherited from his gransparents at birth.  He studied to be a mechanic but took up the responsibilities of planting to help his mother, who has no one else to help her.  During fixed times of the year he devotes his time to caring for their crops of potatoes, peas, beans and corn.  He hires workers to help harvest the crops and sell the produce at the city market, where profits are good.  

José has two parcels of farmland, which allow him to plant as much as is necessary.  However, he hopes to find a way to buy one more plot of land.  He is currently raising money for this purpose.  When he is not occupied planting, he works in a machine shop.  There the pay is a considerable sum of money and allows him to save money and help his family.

José is a member of the "San Lorenzo Strength" solidarity group and this is his second loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. He is happy to have the necessary capital to improve his business and thereby improve his family's quality of life.  He enjoys being a member of the association because the members are caring and hardworking people.  José will invest loan proceeds in the purchase of 15 kilos of alfalfa seed and rent a tractor to cultivate the land for planting corn.

loans.use: to buy 15 kilos of alfalfa seed and rent a tractor.

loans.name: G.s. Hospital Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Hospital II esta conformado por  dos integrantes las cuales son: Claudia del Carmen y Nubia del Socorro, donde oxilan en la edades de 40 al a los 60 anos, Claudia tiene dos  hijos de 12, 22 anos  bajo su responsabilidad los cuales estudian en secundaria y en la universidad. Ellas  pertenecen al departamento de Chinandega que esta ubicado en el occidente del país, un lugar que se caracteriza por su gente muy trabajadora, una zona muy comercial donde el comercio es prospero. Claudia del Carmen es la cordinadora del banco comunal,  la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, y cuenta con ocho experiencia. Dicha actividad la desempeñan de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Claudia  es salir a la calles en horas muy temprana cargando un bulto como de 20 kg o mas donde lleva su mercadería a sus clientes fijos y eventuales estos productos también los distribuyen de créditos a sus clientes recuperando el dinero de forma quincenal que es la forma común de recibir pago en nuestro país. Con el financiamiento   invertira  en capital de trabajo y comprar mercadería como: ropa de niños, de adultos, sandalias, cosméticos .  Claudia exterioriza que en un futuro no muy lejano su sueños es ver formados a sus hijos profesionalmente, y tener una tienda de  mercadería variada para ofrecer sus productos y dejar tener una rutina de trabajo menos pesada. Ya que su trabajo en la actualidad es muy duro andar en la calle bajo el intenso sol del día a día. Pero de igual forma agradecen a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y de países pobres como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The “Hospital II” solidarity group has two members: Claudia del Carmen and Nubia del Socorro.  Their ages range between 40 and 60 years.  Claudia has two children who are 12 and 22 years old and still in her care; they attend secondary school and university.  They live in Chinandega Department which is located in the west of the country, a place noted for its very hardworking people.  It’s a very commercial zone where commerce is profitable.  Claudia del Carmen is the coordinator of the community bank.  She has 8 years of experience selling general merchandise from door to door.   

Claudia’s daily routine is to head out into the streets very early in the morning carrying a bundle that weighs about 20 kilograms or more filled with her merchandise.  She takes her merchandise both to her regular customers and any others who she sells to on credit collecting payment by-weekly which is the customary way of collecting payment in this country.

She intends to use the loan to invest in working capital and buy merchandise like clothes for children and adults, sandals and cosmetics.  

Claudia states that in a not too distant future her dream is to see her children become professionals and to have a general store to sell her merchandise in and thus have a less demanding work routine since her current way of working is very demanding because she has to wander the streets under the hot sun all day.  

They thank Kiva lenders for the help they give small merchants of limited resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo is 60 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up cattle for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $15 daily. Sambo is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children complete higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Somphos' Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Somphos is a young 25-year-old mother.  She must care for her two children as they are still in school. To manage the daily basic needs in her household, she has been in rice farming for five years as the primary source of income. To increase the family's income, she weaves mats for resale, and her husband catches fish. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR, and she manages to save around 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Somphos received the first loan from VisionFund a cycle ago, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loan, which she completely paid back, has supported her business and helped her provide a decent income for her family. Now, in a group of two, Somphos is a group leader. She is applying for 500,000 KHR while her co-member is seeking for 600,000 KHR. Somphos will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will boost her yield so she can increase production and earn more income to sustain her living conditions and keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive desde hace 18 años junto a Olmes, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia. Todas las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus vacas, pues desde muy temprano las saca a los campos naturales para que se alimenten de pastos sanos y nutritivos. Gracias a sus cuidados, vende la leche que produce sus vacas a los comerciantes, para que realicen productos lácteos. Cuenta que al día vende de 22 a 25 litros de leche fresca. Pero como gusta de cuidar animales, además de brindarle buenos ingresos, también tiene ovejas, cerdos, cuyes y conejos, los cuales comercializa en carne a la feria que se desarrolla en Jauja, pero si tiene suerte los mismos compradores visitan su casa. Pues ella es muy conocida, ya que siembra productos agrícolas como papa, alverja y maíz, los cuales vende en su misma chacra y en épocas de cosecha, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Fuerza san lorenzo” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Elizabeth, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 parcelas de alfalfa para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 38 years old, is a hardworking woman. She has lived together with her husband, Olmes, for 18 years. Together they have 3 children whom they are raising in their own house. Every morning is dedicated to the care of their cows, as they very early takes them out to the natural fields to feed them with healthy and nutritious grasses. Thanks to this care, she sells the milk produced by the cows to merchants, from which they make dairy products. She says that she sells 22 to 25 liters of fresh milk a day. Besides liking caring for animals, they also provide her with good income. She also has sheep, pigs, guinea pigs, and rabbitts, which sells sells the meat from in the market that developed in Jauja. If she's lucky, the same buyers visit her house. She is well known for being a hardworking woman as she also plants agricultural products like potatoes, pease, and corn which she sells in the same farm and harvest season. 
She belongs to the support group "Fuerza san Lorenzo" and this is the second loan with MFP. She is happy because she has the necessary capital to improve her business and improve her quality of life. Additionally she like belonging to the association because its members are supportive and hardworking people. Elizabeth will invest the requested funds into the purchase of 2 plots of alfalfa to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy two plots of land planted with alfalfa.

loans.name: Ines Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Inés, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 16, 13, 8  y dos de 7 años ya que son gemelas las menores, todos estudian dos en colegio y los tres menores en escuela. Su esposo es policía.
 
Ella estudia idiomas en una universidad local, es una muy buena madre que lucha todos los días por superarse, también se dedica al comercio ya que tiene  un pequeño local en su casa en la cual vende helados de la marca Pingüino, vende mientras esta en sus casa ya que en las noches se dirige a sus estudios pero  en estas horas sus hijos le ayudan con su negocio, tiene más de tres años con su negocio el cual le permite ganar lo necesario para continuar con sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar helados y tener bien surtido su negocio. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella está mejorando su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y mejorar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The “August 30” communal bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza perrish in the city of Portoviejo, a place knows as being a very commercial zone, also for its traditional festivals in San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its people’s happiness.

Inés lives here.  She is 32 years old, married and has five children, ages 16, 13, 8, and two age 7; they are twins.  They all attend school.  Her husband is a policeman.

She studies language at the local university and she’s a good mother who works hard every day to get ahead.  She also has a small shop in her home where she sells Pingüino brand frozen.  She’s been doing this for more than three years and it allows her to earn what she needs to continue with her studies.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy frozen treats and better stock her store.  This is the third cycle for the communal bank and she likes the loans because she is improving her business.
 
Her dreams are to complete her studies and continue to improve the business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es: El señor  Cornelio con residencia fija en la comunidad de Villa Junín de la provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive en su comunidad con su familia y su esposa y sus cuatro hijos menores, la descripción de su casa está construido de barro con techo de teja con revoques de barro la determinación es rustico prácticamente, la comunidad del cliente esta a 4 km al este de la localidad de Tiraque. La actividad económica es la agricultura que produce tubérculos, la producción es estacional en la zona son alturas del valle alto. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de terreno agrícola, el cliente tiene interés de superarse sus ingresos económicos en los próximos años, los trabajos agrícolas lo realizan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos para la siembra y la cosecha los labores culturales trabajan la familia.
texts.en: Cornelio lives in Villa Junín, within the Tiraque province in the Cochabamba department.  He lives there with his family, his wife, and his four children.  His house is made of adobe, with a thatch ceiling; it’s a rustic home.  The community is 4km to the east, in Tiraque.  He raises tubers, the main product within the high valley in the zone.  He will use the money from this loan to buy farmland.  He wants to increase his income in the coming years.  His whole family works the farm and in some cases, his neighbors also help with the planting and harvest.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Jhossy

texts.es: Jhossy, de 28 años es un hijo responsable; vive en compañía de su mamá Gudelia, su papá Cirilo y su hermano pequeño Miguel a los que cuida en la casa de la comunidad, desde hace 3 años. Él trabajo al que se dedica este ejemplar hijo es la crianza de ovejas de raza denominada “Junín”, que es su principal especialidad; ya que aprendió a cuidarlos y reproducirlos, pues tiene clientes ganaderos que compran sus ejemplares para sus rebaños, en especial machos que les sirven como reproductores. “Esta actividad es mi principal distracción”, comenta. Además estudió la carrera de ingeniería informática, ahora se encuentra trabajando en un hospital del estado peruano en esa área, ahí recibe un sueldo mensual que le permite mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia, pues apoya a su mamá en los gastos del hogar. Entre sus planes se encuentra seguir estudiando y abrir un negocio sólido que le permita sostener sus gastos a largo plazo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Jhossy, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas de buena raza para dinamizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jhossy, 28, is a responsible son.  He lives with his mother and father, Gudelia and Cirilo, and his little brother, Miguel.  He has taken care of them for three years in the house in the community.

The job this exemplary son does is raise sheep of the Junín breed, which is his main specialty because he learned how to take care of them and breed them.  He has rancher customers who buy his sheep for their herds, especially males for breeding.  "This job is my main entertainment," he says.

He also studied computer engineering, and now he's working in that field in a Peruvian state hospital.  He receives a monthly salary that allows him to support his family's financial stability because he helps his mother with the household expenses.  One of his plans is to continue studying and open a solid business that will allow him to support his expenses over the long term.

He belongs to Hacienda Communal Bank and this is his fourth loan with MFP, where he's happy because he receives everybody's help, which allows him to continue in his business.  He also promises to make his payments punctually because his bank is made up of responsible and supportive people.

Jhossy will invest the requested money in buying sheep of a good breed to energize his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: El señor Hernan es una persona muy trabajadora indican varias personas de su zona, el esta separado hace mas de seis años de su pareja, actualmente vive solo, hace dos años que él trabaja en la localidad de puerto villarroel, se dedica a la pesca, cuenta con un pequeño barquito de pesca con un motor fuera de borda que se compro de segunda mano, él se levanta a muy tempranas horas por la mañana para ir a rio arriba y así poder pescar los mejores peces y poder comercializarlos en el pueblo, vive con sus dos hijos, cabe señalar que sus hijos son personas casadas e independientes, él es muy feliz alado de sus nietos pero él se esmera para tratar de llevar una vida mejor junto a su familia, el necesita mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo y así mejorar su desempeño en la pesca
texts.en: Various people who live near Hernan said he is a very hard working person. He has been separated from his wife for the last six years. He is currently single. For the past two years he has been working in Puerto Villarroel. He earns an income by fishing. He has a small fishing boat with an outboard motor, which he bought secondhand. He wakes up very early in the morning, to go up river, where he is able to catch the best fish and later sells them in town. He lives with his two sons, but it should be noted that his sons are both married and independent. He is very happy to be living with his grand children, but he works hard to be able to provide a better quality of life to his family. He needs to make improvements to his work tools, which will allow him to catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase tools and do maintenance on the tools he currently uses for fishing.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel  de 26 anos de edad. Casada con un hijo de  2 anos. Correspondiente al municipio de malpaisillo.  Este municipio es un lugar muy acogedor, con gente muy honrada, trabajadora, se caracteriza por ser una zona agrícola muy productiva. El negocio de María Isabel consiste en una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su localidad . Una pulpería es una tienda que vende productos de consumo diario al por menor como: bolsitas de café, cigarro menudeados, ¼ de aceite, azúcar x ½ y un 1 libra, tomates x unidad, hielos en bolsas, refrescos naturales, cuajadas, pan por unidad. Tiene 4 anos de experiencia en el negocio. María Isabel ya ha tenido crédito con fundación el cual ha manejado de forma responsable en tiempo y forma. En esta ocasión esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar más productos de consumo diario y surtir su pequeña pulpería, y de dicha forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, y obtener mejores ganancias. El negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de tener una forma más de ingresos y poder ayudar con los gastos y crianza de su hijo y gasto  de la casa. María Isabel tiene sueños y metas como cualquier otra persona, ella desea en un futuro poder llegar y formar a su hijo en un profesional ya que ella no lo pudo realizar por falta de recursos económicos de sus padres y quiere brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo para que tenga un futuro mejor. Agradece en gran manera la ayuda  a los inversionistas kiva que les brinda a personas de escasos recurso para tener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 26, is married and has a two-year-old son.  She lives in the town of Malpaisillo, a very welcoming place known as a very productive agricultural region with honest and hardworking people.

María Isabel's business is a small grocery store located in the town bus terminal.  She sells everyday necessities retail such as bags of coffee, cigarettes, oil, sugar by the half pound and pound, tomatoes by unit, bags of ice, natural drinks, curd, and bread by the loaf.  She has four years of experience in this business.

María Isabel has had a previous loan with the foundation and she used it responsibly both in time and use.  Now she's requesting a loan to invest in working capital to buy more everyday necessity products and supply her small store.  This way she'll be able to respond to her customers' demands and earn more profits.

She started the business with the goal of having another form of income to be able to help with the expenses of raising her daughter and of the household.  María Isabel has dreams and goals just like anyone else.  She wants to be able to shape her daughter into a professional in the future, which she couldn't do so herself because her parents lacked the economic resources.  She wants to give her daughter better living conditions so she'll have a better future.

She's very grateful for the help of the Kiva investors, which gives people of limited resources a means to a decent life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: In

texts.en: In has been a cultivator for almost 10 years and she is an experienced farmer. In and her husband help each other handle this farming project to raise their family out of poverty. Their ambition is to provide quality of life and good education to their two children, who are currently at school. In typically grows various kinds of rice, beans, and vegetables to sell to local traders or market vendors. The main challenges of the family's businesses are reduced crop yield because of pests, and flooding that happens occasionally. In order to maintain healthier production and enjoy a better harvest this year, In really needs farming supplies to apply to her crops at the right time and in a suitable manner. That is why she decided to take out a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and also to pay for labor costs. This will make her family more productive in their farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and also to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Gloria Domitila

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional,  se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual es mayor de edad, está casado y aun vive en su casa. Su esposo no trabaja por razones de salud.

Doña Gloria con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja de tres a cuatro  días a la semana, deja a crédito y que  cobra cada 8 días. Lleva  5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: perfumes, cremas,cosméticos, bisutería, entre otras cosas.  Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito emprendió su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
Para el Futuro de la Mujer Communal Bank meets every two weeks in La Pila, in Montecristi Canton.  This place is very well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture.  A wide variety of arts and crafts is made here according to traditional customs.

Gloria, 48, lives here.  She's married and from this relationship has an adult son who's married and still lives at home.  Her husband doesn't work for health reasons.

Gloria makes a living in sales, selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) with the goal of earning something on her own and being able to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells door-to-door three or four days a week.  She leaves products on credit and collects every week.  She has been doing this work for five years and it's going very well for her.

She's going to use this loan to buy more merchandise: perfume, cream, cosmetics, costume jewelry, and other things.  She has been with her communal bank for five years and she likes it because with the first loan she started her business.

Her dream is to have a car for doing her route.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Denys Rolando

texts.es: Denys Rolando de  30 anos de edad, casado con 2 hijos, de 8, 5 anos, del municipio del Sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la zona occidente del país. Denys tiene por actividad económica el servicio de soldadura que consiste en soldar mueble, verjas de hierro, los perlines de los techos, soldaduras de puerta y portones de hierro. Anos de tener el negocio 10 anos. Y ofrece su servicio de forma ambulante. Denys ya ha manejado crédito con fundación y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. En la actualidad el problema familiar que enfrenta es la enfermedad de unos de sus hijos porque es asmático. Y es lo que le da fuerza para seguir trabajando duro para brindarle mayor seguridad y estabilidad a su pequeño hijo. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes. Denys Rolando agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Denis Rolando is 30 years old, and is married with two children, who are ages eight and five. He and his family live in the municipality of Sauce, which is located in the western region of Nicaragua. Denis makes a living working as a welder, and works on furniture, metal gates, fences, doors, roofs, etc. He has been operating his business for ten years, and has already demonstrated that he can successfully make prompt loan repayments.

One of Denis' children is asthmatic and suffers from associated health complications, which has also presented the whole family with significant challenges. Denis works very hard to provide for his family, and especially to take care of his youngest son in this tough time. He plans to use the support from this loan to invest in his business and hopefully offer higher quality work and services to his clients. He is grateful to lenders for their support of him personally, as well as their support for borrowers in Nicaragua and across the world who have scarce resources and desire honest, dignified jobs.

loans.use: to invest in work materials, such as a welding iron, to improve the quality of work and services he offers to his clients.

loans.name: Sokim's Group

texts.en:
As one of the breadwinners in a family consisting of six children who are students, Sokim is a 53-year-old mother originally from a rural village of Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district. Her main source of income is rice-cropping. Her husband also helps to make more income via producing palm sugar. Sokim is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and save around 10,000 KHR each day for the emergency case. 

In a group of two female members, this is the fifth loan cycle for Sokim and fourth loan cycle for her co-member. The past loan, which she has paid back, has supported her family gradually with decent food. Now, she and her fellow co-member are seeking a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Sokim will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to receive a high quality cash-crop and sell at a good price, so she can earn more profit to maintain her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Monserrate  Lourdes

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

Aquí vive la señorita Monserrate, tiene 31 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella estudia Comercio Exterior en una  universidad de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por  5 años y le gustan los créditos ya que estos le  ayudan a financiar su negocio.

Ella además de sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana, además de vender por su localidad también les vende a sus compañeras de clases,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa la va a comprar cada fin de mes a Guayaquil, ya que allá le sale más barato. Tiene diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
The “Para el Futuro De la Mujer” meets every two weeks in the town of Montecristi.  This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture and a great variety of art, made in the traditional way, can be found here.

Monserrate lives here.  She’s 31 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  She studies business at the university in Manta and has been with the communal bank for five years.  She likes the loans because they help her finance her business.

Aside from her studies, she sells all types of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  She works three or four days a week, selling from her home and also to her classmates.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  She has her products shipped to her home, but she buys her clothing in Guayaquil at the end of the month because it’s cheaper.  She’s been doing this for ten years and things are going well for her. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and all types of clothing.

Her dream is to have her own company.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Vamos En Victoria Group

texts.es: El banco comunal vamos en Victoria esta conformado por 9 integrantes, madres solteras con  15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Y comprenden entre las edades de 32 a 60 anos. Todas son Mujeres del municipio del Sauce que esta ubicado en la parte norte del país. Estas mujeres se han caracterizado por ser trabajadoras, responsables, se conocen entre si   porque viven en el mismo lugar, por lo tanto decidieron aprovechar la modalidad de agrupación en asociación comunal para poder optar al crédito y ayudarse mutuamente con el financiamiento. Martha Melba es la cordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de cada unas de la integrantes para realizar sus pagos en tiempo y forma la actividad que desempena es la  venta de cuajada, venta de leche actividades muy propias de la región. La rutina diaria de de Martha Melba  es de levantar a las 4: 00  de la mañana para aprovechar las ventas de la mañana como es la venta de leche y cuajada y sus derivados son productos que por lo general se necesitan en horas tempranos para mandar a sus hijos desayunados a los  colegios. y Tambien vende de forma ambulante  desde muy temprano hasta casi el anochecer ya que sale  a vender cuajada fuera de su comunidad. Para ella  es muy dura la vida pero es su medio de vida y de sus familia. las integrantes del banco comunal Vamos en Victoria  Agradecen la oportunidad que le brindan los prestamistas kiva  a personas de escasos recursos y de países pobre como es Nicaragua para salir adelante y tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Vamos en Victoria” is made up of nine members, single mothers with 15 children under their responsibility and their ages range from 32 to 60 years old.  All of the women are from the municipality of Sauce that is located in the northern part of the country.  These women have been characterized as being hard-working and responsible.  They have become acquainted with one another because they live in the same place, therefore they decided to take advantage of the method of grouping in a communal association in order to be able apply for the loan and help each other mutually with the financing.  

All of the women have different activities like: the sale of live pigs, the sale of curds and the sale of milk, activities very typical of the region.  The daily routine of these women is to get up at 4:00 in the morning to take advantage of the morning sales like the sale of milk and curds and their by-products.  These are products that are usually needed in the early hours to send children, having had their breakfast, to school.  Also, other members of the bank sell their products as street vendors and they get up very early, almost at nightfall, as they leave to sell outside of their community.  For them it is a very hard life but it is their way of life and that of their families.  

They are grateful for the opportunity that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources and who are from poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can move forward and have a dignified way of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of live pigs, milk and curds.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeurn is 56 years old. She is widowed and lives with her sister in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge for more than two years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her sister is employed in a garment factory. She earns about $2 each day. Yoeurn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to earn more income to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Verónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

Aquí vive la señorita Verónica, tiene 29 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella es una mujer muy preparada que con mucho esfuerzo logro terminar su carrera universitaria es Ing. Comercial y pone en práctica lo aprendido en su negocio.
 
Ella  se dedica al comercio, compra y vende  adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00,  lo que más vende son los centros de mesa y adornos para el hogar.  Lleva 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, ya que con su trabajo pudo terminar sus estudios. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona ya que estos son los mejores de toda la provincia.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por  6 años y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda en los negocios tanto para ella como para sus compañeras.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio en otra ciudad.
texts.en:
The “Para el Futuro De la Mujer” meets every two weeks in the town of Montecristi.  This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture and a great variety of art, made in the traditional way, can be found here.

Verónica lives here.  She’s 29 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  She’s a very prepared woman and succeeded in completing her university studies in business with great effort.  She puts what she’s learned into practice with her business.

She buys and sells decorations and ceramics.  She has a shop within her home where she sells all types of arts and crafts.  She works daily from 8:00am to 5:00pm.  She mostly sells table centerpieces and nick-nacks for the home.  She’s been doing this for seven years and things have gone very well for her and she was able to complete her studies through this work.  She buys her products from artists in the zone, as these are the best in the province.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more artwork of all types and models to stock her business.  She has been with the communal bank for six years and she enjoys it because the loans help her with her business and those of her fellow members.

Her dream is to have a business in another city.

loans.use: to buy art for resale.

loans.name: Ngorongoro Group

texts.en:
Mnyahelu, who is in his early 30's, is married. He has been running food shop for two years now. He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.  

Mnyahelu requests the third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to pay household expenses, restock more food of different kinds in his shop and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to restock the missing items in his food shop. His dream is to one day be able to build his own nice house. 

Mnyahelu will share this loan with his loan group "Ngorongoro" which totals 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his food shop.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
A farmer who lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Thy is 56 years old and married. She has only one child who is dependent on her and helping the family’s business. Rice farming on a nine-hectare area of farmland is the main source of the family’s income, which she has been doing for ten years. The current business earns her around 40,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

Thy is in her second microloan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The successful past loan that she has paid back has unburdened her household and improved her family's livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. Thy will use this loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a mini-tracker for supporting her business. She hopes to make more income from her current business so she can keep up the good progress of her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sokrat's Group

texts.en:
Sokrat is a 29-year-old mother of one daughter. Her family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she has farmed rice on one hectare of farmland for several years, while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to earn extra income for the family. Sokrat can earn about 22,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs.

Sokrat’s group consists of two members who have been with VisonFund for two cycles. She has successfully repaid the loans which have helped her relieve the family’s burden. Now she and her group are seeking a new loan of 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sokrat will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to increase income from her rice paddy so as to set aside some money to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Yelba Del Rosario

texts.es:
Yelba, originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a atender una pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación. Dice que los financiamientos ha aportado de manera positiva a su negocio pues le ayudan a comprar inventario de mucha necesidad entre sus clientes cuando ellos llegan a su pulpería siempre encuentran lo necesario para la comida y eso es una de sus satisfacciones. 
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, papel higiénico, detergentes, jabón, enlatados, sopas, pasta de dientes. Esto inversión la ayudara a mantener surtido su negocio  y ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su anhelo es lograr ampliar más de productos su pulpería.
texts.en:
Yelba, originally from Granada, is a merchant. She attends a grocery store that is in her home. She said that the loans have positively contributed to her business since they help her to buy inventory for basic needs for her clients. When they arrive at her grocery store they always find what they need to prepare a meal. This is one of her satisfactions. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, toilet paper, detergents, soap, cans, soup, and toothpaste. This investment will help her to supply her business and offer a variety of products to her clients. Her goal is to manage more products to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, toilet paper, detergents, soap, cans, soup, and toothpaste

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is getting old as he is now 73 years of age. He is from a low-income family with seven members. He is responsible for five children, but currently only his last-born child lives with him. The other four have started their new families and live separately around Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Net is thankful for a business that allows him to satisfy his family's needs and thinks it’s quite fortunate that he can have enough water from a local irrigation to cover his crops, though there is sometimes a drought.

At present, Net is requesting a loan of 500 USD to buy organic fertilizers and pesticide spray to keep his rice in good condition. These purchases will enable his rice to achieve its optimum growth, which will result in better output in harvest season. In the future, Net would like to purchase extra plots of land to expand his annual production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and pesticide spray to keep his rice in good condition.

loans.name: Nazareth S. N. Group

texts.es:
La señora Dolores, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el municipio de San Nicolás, Santa Bárbara. Dolores es una persona muy emprendedora estableció su propio negocio hace 3 años donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, aceite, cereales, refrescos, salsas, huevos, pan, churros etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y lo ha mantenido surtido con la inversión de varios prestamos. Ella ha solicitado 9 ciclos de créditos con el actual,y también lo utilizara para comprar más productos alimenticios y surtir su negocio de manera que incrementen las ventas ya que en la comunidad viene la temporada buena del corte de café y los clientes tendrán más capacidad económica. Espera seguir creciendo con su negocio para poderle ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
Ella pertenece al Grupo solidario de crédito con nombre Nazareth S. N. que está conformado por dos personas, que viven en la misma comunidad y en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Dolores de blusa negra y Yesenia está a la derecha quien también tiene pulpería. Cada una solicita 15,000 lempiras haciendo un total de 30,000 lempiras en forma grupal. Ellas agradecen a ODEF y ahora a Kiva por apoyarlas con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Dolores is 35 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their two children in the San Nicolás municipality in Santa Bárbara.  

She is a very enterprising woman, and she established her own business three years ago.  She sells basic food products for the family like basic grains, sugar, lard, cooking oil, cereals, soft drinks, salsas, eggs, bread, and churros, etc.  This business is her source of income, and she has kept it stocked with the investment of several loans.

Counting the current loan, she has requested nine cycles of loans.  She will also use it to buy more food products.  She will stock her business so that her sales increase.  The season for harvesting coffee is coming, and the customers will have more capacity to buy.  She hopes to continue growing her business in order to be able to help with her children’s education. 

She belongs to the communal bank named Nazareth S.N.  It is comprised of two people who live in the same community.  In the photo Dolores is to the left and she has on a black blouse.  Yesenia is to the right, and she also has a grocery store.  Each member is requesting a loan of 15,000 Lempiras for a total of 30,000 Lempiras for the group.
