Las socias son mujeres que tienen un gran carisma y mantienen su buen humor a pesar de las adversidades de la vida, pero son luchadoras que día a día buscan la manera de sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Miriam, tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 8, 5  y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es aserrador, la casa en la que viven es propiedad conyugal siendo el fruto del trabajo en su matrimonio. 

Doña Miriam pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos quienes son pequeños, pero como es una mujer emprendedora cría animales como: cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y borregos a los que los vende en su comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, cuyes y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Paraíso” (Paradise) consists of 15 members, 13 women and 2 men. The group has been in existence for nine years. Some of the members have been with the group the entire time, while others have joined over the years. They live in the parish of Cumbe in the city of Cuenca, a place that has both ancient and modern architecture. The streets are colorful and the people are proud that they have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors. These members possess great charisma and have maintained a good sense of humor despite the adversities they have face in life. Every day they strive to find ways to move their families forward.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Miriam. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children (ages 9, 8, 5, and 3). Her three older children attend school in the city. Miriam’s husband is an operator at a saw mill. They own the house in which they live and it was acquired after they got married.

Doña Miriam spends most of her time at home taking care of her children since they are young. However, this enterprising woman also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and sheep and sells them in her community. Miriam also engages in farming, but what she harvests is only used for household consumption. She sells if there is a surplus. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs, guinea pigs, and feed for these animals.

Her goal is to have a vehicle of her own.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Josefina Abigail

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina Abigail;la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos naturales,la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia cuenta con un local donde vende su mercaderia el cual se encuentra ubicado por el centro de la ciudad,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 06:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de productos naturales para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Comuzone I".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, pertaining to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is named Josefina Abigail.  She continues working in the business of natural product sales.  She has been in this business for years, and it's going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it.  She has a store where she sells her merchandise, which is located in the center of the city.  She works from 8 am until approximately 6 pm.  She is a responsible and hardworking person, being that in this way she will get her family ahead.

She requests the loan to buy natural products for her business.

The member is happy to receive the loan and promises to complete the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: María Eufemia

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

La señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, compran y venden adornos y cerámicas,   dos veces por semana ellos compran todo tipo de cerámicas para luego viajar a varias ciudades de la sierra, lugares donde ellos vende sus productos para lo cual se quedan una semana en estos lugares entregando y cobrando lo que llevan, luego regresan descansan una semana y vuelven a viajar. Llevan más de 22 años que se dedican a esta actividad y les ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona ya que son los mejores.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para cumplir con sus clientes. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda y llegan cuando más lo necesita.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local para vender  sin tener que estar viajando y un carro  ya viajan en transporte público.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” meets every two weeks in the town of Montecristi.  This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture and a great variety of art, made in the traditional way, can be found here.

María lives here.  She is 49 years old, married, and has two adult children who are on their own.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband are merchants who buy and sell decorations and ceramics.  They buy all types of ceramics twice a week and then travel to various cities in the mountains, places where they sell their products.  They stay in these areas for a week, making deliveries and collecting.  Then they return home for a week and travel once more.  They’ve been doing this for 22 years and things have gone well for them.  They buy from artists in the zone because they’re the best.

She will use the money from this loan to buy artifacts of all types and styles so they can fill customer orders.  She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because the loans have been a great help and she gets them when she needs them the most.

She dreams of having a shop so that she can sell without traveling, and a car so that they no longer need to travel by public transportation.

loans.use: to buy artifacts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a security wall.

loans.name: Yu

texts.en:
Yu, 43, is a married woman living with her spouse and three single children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Her two older children have married and started their new families. 

Aside from the bustle of farming activities, Yu also pays attention to her hog raising business, which she has operated in a wooden pigpen in her backyard. Upon maturity, she usually sells them to traders and local butchers in her neighborhood. She has been raising piglets for almost five years.

Yu would like to add 10 more pigs to her pig farm, and she will separate the small ones to another place when they are a month old. Due to insufficient capital, Yu is asking for a loan of 1000000 KHR to make this purchase. Through her perseverance and hard work, she hopes to make her businesses a viable source of income for the family and achieve a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase 10 more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Jumanne, who was born in 1976, is married with four children who still go to school.  He has had a food shop business selling rice, beans of different kinds, maize and wheat flour, and sugar since 2002. He is currently needs to start a broiler chicken business. He works from 6am to 10pm daily and he is able to make a small monthly profit.

He request for a fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle and a sofa set, to finish building his family house, to repair his vehicle, and to cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to start broiler chicken business.  His dream is to one day be able to buy a solar power since is cheaper to use than other power sources.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Munduli B" which totals 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start a broiler chicken business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is a thirty-five-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been providing internet and secreterial services for three years, and this business is located on a busy street. He is also a farmer who mainly grows bananas and beans. With the income earned he has been able to build a house for residence. He is challenged by an inefficient supply of electricity and high rental fees for the business premises. He desires educating his child in good schools and seeing him graduate with a master's degree. Edgar intends to use the money to buy a coloured printer and computer accessories for the internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy a coloured printer and computer accessories for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Nuru-Lumo Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 40's, is married with two children who go to school. She has been selling fish for ten years now. She works from 6AM to 10PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to make more bricks, which she expects to use to build her own house, to pay school fees, and to pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more business stock to resell to more customers. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Nuru-Lumo," which totals 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more business stock to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar quien se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace 12 años este negocio lo aprendió hace 30 años y luego él se independizo y creo su propio mercado en el norte del país.  El crédito lo invertirá en zapatos, sandalias…etc.
texts.en: Julio Cesar, who has been selling shoes for 12 years, learned this business 30 years ago.  He then began working on his own and created his own market in the northern part of the country.  He will use the money from this loan to buy shoes, sandals, etc…

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Ivan Ignacio

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

El señor Iván, tiene 29 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Su esposa es artesana y comerciante. 

El es artesano y junto a su esposa elaboran todo tipo de cerámicas, las mismas que luego de darles el acabado las ponen a exhibición  en su local pues ellos también tienen un local en una vía principal donde muchas personas se dedican a este tipo de  comercio, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, mientras el se dedica a elaborar sus obras su esposa es la encargada de realizar las ventas en el local y por las noches ella también le ayuda en su labor. Llevan más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y les va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar cerámica para la elaboración de estas obras. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son mucho más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio local ya que donde venden es de su papá.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” communal bank meets every two weeks in the town of Montecristi.  This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture and a great variety of art, made in the traditional way, can be found here.

Ivan is 29 years old, married, and has an eight month old son.  His wife is an artist and a merchant.

He is an artist and makes all sorts of ceramics along with his wife.  They display them in their shop after putting the finishing touches on them.  Their shop is on a main street where there are many people who do this kind of business.  He works daily from 8:00am to 5:00pm.  His wife makes sales while he creates pieces.  She also helps him in the evenings.  They have been doing this for more than 12 years and things are going well for them.

He will use the money from this loan to buy ceramic to create more works.  This will be the third cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other lending institutions.

His dream is to have a shop of his own.  The one he has now belongs to his father.

loans.use: to buy ceramic.

loans.name: Fany Monica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de costureria,la socia confecciona vestidos,camisas,sacos entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia,la socia trabaja de forma independiente y a pedido de acuerdo a los distintos compromisos que puedan tener sus clientes,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de telas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Fany Monica belongs to the community bank Comuzone I. She continues in her sewing business; she makes dresses, shirts, and jackets, among other things. She has been in this business for years, which has gone well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She works independently and on request in agreement with different arrangements made with her customers. She is a responsible person and knows that this is how she will get her family ahead in life.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics for her business. 

She is appreciative of the granted loan and promises to comply with her established payments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en: Ne’ma, a 27-year-old married woman, has two sons. To help her husband in paying the household bills, she started working with the help of her husband in the evenings making different types of cleaning products in a separate room in the house. They mix basic materials at home, then fill small gallons for sale. She has applied for this youth loan to increase her productivity by buying a larger amount of raw material.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of raw chemical material.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children who lives in a rural area of Moung Russey district, located in Battambang province, Cambodia. Four of her children, two sons and two daughters, are dependent on her and are still in school while the other one is assisting in the family’s business. She struggles to make her daily living via rice cultivation and supplements her family income via working as a paid worker.

Mom and her husband earn their living through farming rice. Each day, she can earn around 24,000 KHR. She is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past successful loans, which she has fully paid back, have enabled her to relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood progressively. She is now leading a group of two members to request a new loan--the other member is a sixth-cycle client with VisionFund. As a group leader, Mom will use her new loan portion to purchase fertilizers for her farmland and a small portion of it to cover her household expenses (food). She highly hopes that her rice field will provide her with a higher crop yields and a higher income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Sator

texts.ru: Сатору 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 16 лет назад он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей продуктов питания.  Он продает рис, макарон, масло и т.п. Он продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет много клиентов. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он должен купить товар для расширения ассортимента, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США  для покупки продуктовых товаров. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погашать займ во время.
texts.en:
Sator is 48 years old. He is married and raising two children.  

In order to support his family and to provide them with all the necessities, he started his own business 16 years ago, buying and selling food products.  He sells rice, pasta, oil etc. at the local market and has many customers.  

Thanks to his efficiency, Sator is successful in business.  He currently needs to buy some merchandise to expand his inventory.  However he does not have enough funding to do so.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 USD to buy food products.  

Sator is relying on your kindness and promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy food items for resale.

loans.name: Erdenchimeg

texts.en:
Erdenchimeg, who is 27 years old, lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a modest and calm tempered woman. Her husband's name is Bumanbaatar; he operates his own retail computer business. Her husband has an apartment mortgage loan. Her son and daughter go to kindergarten. 

Previously, Erdenchimeg worked for a private company as a salesperson, and in 2010 she started her own business selling children's toys, neonatal clothes and perfume in a rented space. She lacks working capital, however, so she needs 4000000 MNT to purchase inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Geovanie Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Geovanie es una persona que se dedica a la Agricultura desde hace muchos años, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador y luchador, pretende cultivar otro tipo de hortalizas por eso agradece desde ya el apoyo que le han brindado con este financiamiento. El y su esposa trabajan en conjunto, cuentan con una pulperia en la zona donde habitan, de los productos que cultiva los saca a vender todos los sabados al Mercadito que se lleva a cabo en Rama, sus proyectos es expandir sus cultivos en otros mercados fuera de la zona ya tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Geovanie has been farming since for many years.  He is known for being very hardworking and wants to raise another type of vegetable.  He appreciates the support he has gotten through this loan.  He and his wife work together and run a general store in the zone where they live.  He takes his harvest to sell in the small market they have every Saturday in Rama.  He plans to expand his harvests to other markets outside the zone and to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Nekemia, who is in her late thirties, is married with three children (two girls and a boy) who are in school.  She has been running a retail shop for a half year now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

She requests her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She expects to use the loan to restock the inventory in the retail shop and to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to one day own a big bar and also to look after cows, broiler chickens and goats.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Norway," which totals 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock retail shop inventory and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: A 31-year-old resident named Khoeun lives in a rural area of Prey Chhor district located in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is married and has three dependent children: one daughter and two sons. To feed her family, Khoeun farms rice on one and a half hectares of farmland, a business that she has been involved in for 11 years, and raises 600 heads of duck, a business which she has been involving for only 3 years. Her main challenge is having insufficient working capital to support her business. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 1,010 USD. This will be her first loan with VisionFund. Some portion of her first loan will be spending on covering the expenses on the rice field such as buying fertilizers and rice seeds, while the other portion will be spent on buying feed for her ducks. She hopes to see an improvement in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and duck feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Svetik

texts.en:
Svetik lives with her daughter in Banavan village of the Ararat region. Svetik is a nurse at a school in Ararat, and her daughter works in the school of Vanashen, a neighboring village. Svetik and her daughter also run a farm, where they cultivate tomatoes and grow peach, apricot and pear trees. 

Svetik wants to start autumn sowing, but she doesn't have sufficient means to do so. She has applied for this loan to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation, and to pay for watering the land. Svetik will also hire workers to assist in the cultivation process. This will allow Svetik to gather a good harvest of tomatoes to sell in order to earn enough income to re-invest in her agriculture business next year.

loans.use: to pay for hired workers, fertilizer, seeds, and watering the land.

loans.name: Orgodol

texts.en: Orgodol is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife, Natsagnyam, is 35 years old. His son, Nyamdorj, is 13 years old, and is a secondary school student. Orgodol makes deels, the national clothing, and Mongolian yurt covers with his wife. His monthly business net profit is 350,000 - 550, 000 MNT. In his free time, he operates a taxi service. He is planning to expand his business and improve his profit. He is a hardworking and honest man. He needs 1 750 000 MNT to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a determined and hardworking husband and father of five. Four of his children are married, and his other child is a farmer. Ernesto's wife has been running their livestock business while he has been busy running their corn field and furniture business.

Ernesto's main priority is to develop his finished furniture products so he can sell them at a greater price and encourage more customers to patronize his business. To make his goal possible, he requests a bigger loan amount of PHP15,000 which will be used to buy additional wood and varnish to improve his furniture business. He hopes to make his business more profitable and productive so he can become a better entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: To buy additional wood and varnish for his furniture business

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en: Kheun lives in Ek Phnom District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a 59-year-old married mother blessed with one daughter and three sons. Some of her children are assisting in their mother’s business, which is selling grocery items, whereas the others are working as paid workers in Korea. Kheun earns a living by selling grocery items and has been involved in this business for 30 years. To supplement the income, Kheun’s husband also plants rice and sesame. Kheun has been with VisionFund for five cycles already and has completely paid back all loans. The past loans have helped her manage her business gradually. Now, she needs to buy fertilizer to apply to her farmland as well as purchase her grocery items such as soap, canned food, food ingredients, etc. Therefore, she is applying for USD 1,000.00 with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She hopes to grow her crop timely so she can generate more income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and grocery items.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en: Sokheang, 24, is a resident in a rural area of Thmor Koul district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of four young children, two daughters and two sons. She has five years of experience in her current businesses, which are rice farming and iron welding. This is her first loan through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a USD 500.00 loan with VisionFund. She will utilize some portion of her loan to support her five-hectare farmland by buying fertilizer and rice seeds. She will use the other portion to buy extra supplies for her iron-welding business. This young potential entrepreneur, Sokheang, believes that with this loan, she can mprove her business and boost her income so that she will be able to build a bright future for her children by sending them to a good school and guarantee food security for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed and welding materials.

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en: Sothea is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. One of her children is dependent on her and currently in school. Sothea and her husband feed their family through farming rice, working as paid workers, and raising pigs. Sothea has been in the business for 20 years, earning approximately 20,000KHR per day. She and her fellow group member are now applying for their first loans with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a group leader, Sothea will utilize her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pig feed in order to fatten her pigs. She hopes to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig's feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Los Girasoles  (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Los Girasoles, ciudad conocida por gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas. Este grupo está formado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres  los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, comercio en general, entre otras actividades. Ellos al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  hace un tiempo atrás para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Gema, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 12 y 7 años de edad, los mismos que estudian dos en un colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
 
Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a sus hijos y a su esposo se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo de la marca leonisa, así como también productos de Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale hacer sus recorridos tres o cuatro días a la semana, ella aprovecha las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en la escuela para realiza  sus  ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas, lleva más  de 9 años en este negocio y  le va muy bien ya que tienen muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar más ropa, perfumes, cremas, accesorios, entre otros  productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de gran ayuda tanto a ella como al grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro o un local propio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Los Girasoles” communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known for its hardworking people and beautiful women.  This group is made up of 11 women and 2 men who work in different fields, such as farming, general sales, and other things.  When they learned about the benefits through the institution, they decided to join a while back to be able to access loans through “Fundación Espoir.”
 
Gema is one of the members.  She’s 38 years old, married and has three children, ages 14, 12, and 7.  They all attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

In order to earn something on her own and be able to help her husband and children as well, she sells all types of Leonisa brand clothing, as well as Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  She sells door to door and goes out three or four times a week.  She takes advantage of mornings while her children are in school.  She sells and collects every week, since she also sells on credit.  She’s been doing this for nine years and has many customers.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, accessories, and other products.  She has been in the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her and the group.

 She would like a car or her own shop.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is a 59-year-old resident in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother of six children. As a widow, she has struggled to feed the family by growing rice on one hectare of farmland for 33 years. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for tuture needs. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy business. 

Thy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisoinFund, for two cycles and completely repaid the past loans while the other members have been with VisionFund from one to two cycles. She has successfully used the past loans to relieve her family’s burden. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Thy will use part of her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland and another portion to pay labor fees. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive so as fulfill her dream to buy plots of farmland for expanding the rice paddy and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Mr. Munhbat is 36 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house in Ulaanbaatar city. He has been managing a firewood trading business in the biggest wood products market of Ulaanbaatar city. He buys the firewood from rural wholesalers and then retails it in one day. Although he now sells only firewood, his plan is to increase his product line by adding timber and raw materials, which he will sell to construction companies. He is responsible for transportation and sales and his wife is responsible for the bookkeeping part of his business. Now they have an old truck and they are planning to buy a new one. Therefore, he is asking for 2,000,000 MNT, which he will add to some money that he has saved, for the cost of the new truck. He has had two previous loans that were paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new truck

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia vende lo que son pantalones,casacas,chompas entre otros,la socia cuenta con un local lugar donde vende su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como casacas al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone. She continues with her clothing sales business. She has been doing this for years, and  the business is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business. She sells such items as pants, jackets, and sweaters, among other items. She has a location where she sells her merchandise to her customers, who seek her out. She is a responsible and striving person, since it is in this way that she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase merchandise, such as jackets, wholesale. She is grateful for the credit offered and promises to comply with her established payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as jackets, wholesale

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
Koem, is 46 years old and lives in a rural area of the Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkoul Borey district, Cambodia. She has three children, all of whom work as paid construction workers in Thailand. She has farmed rice on one hectare of farmland and worked as a paid worker in her local area to support the family. Having been in this business for 29 years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Lack of working capital to support her current business is still the main challenge.

Koem’s group consists of four members who live in the same village and she is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. She has fully paid back the past loan which has helped her improve her family's living conditions gradually. She is now leading her group to request a loan. Koem will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to increase income from her paddy field so as to set aside some money to build a proper house for her family and to buy plots of farmland for expanding her rice-cropping business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Aged 61, Ann is married with three children, one of whom is dependent on her and works as a tailor in the local area. The main source of the family’s income is from growing oranges, which she has been in for thirty years and she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

Ann’s group consists of three members who live in the same village of Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia, and she is on her fifth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely repaid the loans which have helped her to improve her family’s condition. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. Ann, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and to pay the water pumping fee for her plantation. She will use a portion of the loan to buy piglets to raise to earn extra income. She hopes this loan will help her gain more income so as to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plantation

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat is 33 years old. She is married and resides with 5 children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $4 a day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 a day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Nat is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer for resale. By doing so, she would earn additional income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for resale

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Yorn is a 39-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for almost 20 years and supplementing her income by selling grocery items in her local area. The current business earns her about 10,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day for her future needs. Lack of working capital for supporting her current business is still the main challenge.

Yorn is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Yorn will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sreyna's Group

texts.en:
Sreyna is 22 years old and a farmer who resides in a rural area of the Bakan district, Pursat province, Cambodia. She has one dependent son who is too young for school. To support the family, she has been farming rice on 1.5 hectare of farmland while her husband complements the family’s income by working as a motorcycle repairer in their local area. She is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sreyna’s group consists of five female members who just joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner) this cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy spare parts for her husband’s motorcycle repair business. She hopes this loan will help her husband to have sufficient spare parts for his repair business and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her husband’s motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino, de 32 años, es un hombre trabajador y se esmera por sobresalir adelante, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Nery de 32 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Paulino, es labrar la tierra y sembrar plantas de café cuenta con 03 hectáreas de propiedad y en esta parcela ha cultivado plantas de café, y que es más rentable y tienen mayor demanda en  las sociedades acopiadoras. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar y lo hace con mucha perseverancia, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los puntos de venta situados a una hora de su comunidad; lo que prioriza Paulino es en realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos como haciendo el desyerbo, fumigar y abonarlo para luego obtener buena producción. Este es su crédito número 02, esta llano a aportar sus cuotas puntualmente como lo venia haciendo en sus anteriores créditos, en su banco comunal es un socio participe y  puntual en toda las reuniones acordadas.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono para mantener fértiles sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Paulino, 32, is a hardworking man who strives to make progress.  He lives in his own home along with his wife Nery, 32, and their 4 beloved children, for whom they wish to provide a better quality of life.  Paulino is a farmer who cultivates coffee.  He owns 3 hectares of land.  He cultivates coffee plants on his land because this is the most profitable crop, and there is a lot of demand for it from the wholesalers.

What Paulino likes most about his work is the harvest, and he carries it out with a lot of perseverance.  He has been farming for 15 years, and what he considers most difficult is to transport his products from the farm to the sales points, which are located an hour away from his community.  Paulino's priority is to maintain his crops with herbicides, fumigants and organic fertilizers, so that he can get a good yield.  This is his second loan, and he is ready to make his payments on time like he did with his previous loan.  He is an active participant in his communal bank, and he is on time for all of the scheduled meetings.  

With the 2,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting, he will buy fertilizers to keep his coffee plants fertile.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is from the small village of Kaspi district. She is 47 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and son-in-law. Her husband works as a road builder and her son-in-law is a security guard. Both of them earn monthly income. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm of 3 milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Iamze produces cheese and sells it in her village and in the nearby villages. 
To help support the family and improve their living conditions, Iamze and her daughter started a small retail business selling clothes and different kinds of household items from their house. Iamze works hard to do her best for her family members.

She requested a loan to purchase a supply of nuts. Nuts are cheap now and the price significantly increases in the winter months. Iamze will keep nuts and subsequently sell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Iamze plans to set up her own store in the capital city. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase nuts for resale

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
Sem is aged 55 years and married. She has two children. Her family lives in a rural village of the Bakan district of Pursat province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has farmed rice for thirty-three years and supplemented the family’s income by producing Vietnamese crepes for sale. She can earn about 14,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for her business.
 
Sem’s group consists of five members who live in the same village. She is on her first cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek out a loan. Sem, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy ingredients, including rice flour, sugar, and bean sprout for making Vietnamese crepes. She hopes this loan will help her earn more income so as to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Helen Zulema

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I,la socia continua con su negocio de agencia de viajes ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de paquetes turisticos como camino inka,salkantay,city tours,valle sagrado,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de jugueria , siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de boletos turisticos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. She continues with her travel agency business. She has had this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business. She sells different types of tourist packages, such as the Inca Trail, the Salkantay trek, city tours, and the Sacred Valley. She is a responsible and hard-working person. At the same time, she continues her juice stand business. This is how she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase tourist tickets. She feels thankful for the loan offered and promises to make the agreed-upon payments.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb is a 44-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a farmer residing in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who grows rice on a three-hectare area of farmland. Having been in this business for twenty-four years, she is able to earn around 20,000 KHR per day and save approximately 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The main challenge for her paddy is drought.

Chreb’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle already. She completely repaid back the past loan which has helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Chreb, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for gasoline for water pumping. She hopes to grow her rice more healthfully and timely so as to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de chompas,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 06:00pm aproximadamente ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende diferentes tipos de modelos de chompas y de distintos colores a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de chompas de alpaca.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. She continues with her business of selling sweaters. She works from approximately 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has had this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She sells different types of sweaters in different colors to her customers, who seek her out. She is a responsible and hard-working person, since this is the way she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase alpaca sweaters.  She is grateful for the loan offered and promises to make the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Chhean's Group

texts.en:
Chhean lives in a rural area in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is a 60-year-old widowed mother of one child. She has farmed rice on three-hectares of farmland for 30 years. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn around 40,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field business. 

Chhean’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. This is the fifth loan for her and one of her co-members with Kiva's partner  VisionFund and the third loan for a remaining fellow group member. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to increase the income from her current business. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Chhean, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice more fruitfully and sell it for a high price so she can save some money to build a decent kitchen.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Erhembayar

texts.en: Mr. Erhembayar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife's name is Enhtuya and she helps with his business. His daughter stays at home because she is three years old. In 2012, he started his own grocery business in a rented space in the local trade center. He is a hardworking and modest person. Today, Mr Erhembayar needs a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for his retail grocery business.  He is planning to invest the profits from the business to buy his own grocery store. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Mirian, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Rolando su esposo. Ambos tienen 5 hijos pero solo viven junto a su nieto a quien cuidan en la casa que heredó de su madre desde hace 10 años. El trabajo por más de 20 años de Mirian se centra en la elaboración de pequeñas roscas y bocados típicos de la zona de Jauja, los cuales lleva a comercializar a la feria que se desarrolla en la ciudad, donde ella viaja los días miércoles y domingos, “despierto desde muy temprano para preparar los dulces, pues tengo que preparar en cantidad para mis clientes”, comenta. Es así que obtiene muy buenas ganancias, comenta también que durante los demás días de la semana tiene algunos pedidos eventuales que siempre le brindan más ingresos. Es así que ahora desea seguir mejorando sus ingresos y especializándose en lo que mejor sabe hacer, “las rocas de Jauja”. Este es el crédito número 9 con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues durante todo estos años el dinero le ayudó en dinamizar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos, además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación donde las personas son solidarias. Mirian, invertirá el dinero en la compra de harina por sacos para la elaboración de los panes de harina.
texts.en:
Mirian, who is 48 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, Rolando. Together they have 5 children, but they live only with their grandson, whom they care for in the house she inherited from her mother 10 years ago. Mirian's work for more than 20 years has centered on the preparation of little doughnuts and snacks typical of the Jauja zone. She takes them to sell in the market that sets up in the city, where she travels every Wednesday and Sunday. "I get up very early to prepare the sweets, since I have to prepare them in quantity for my customers," she comments. It is thus that she obtains very good earnings. She comments that during the other days of the week she also has some occasional orders that always offer her more income. Thus she now wants to continue improving her income and specializing in what she best knows how to make, "Jauja doughnuts." 

This is her 9th loan from MFP, and so she promises to be punctual in making the payments, since during all these years the money has helped her invigorate her business and consequently her income. In addition, she is happy to belong to her group, where the people are united. Mirian will invest the money in the purchase of bags of flour to make her wheat breads.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour to make bread

loans.name: Yass' Group

texts.en:
A 46-year-old mother, Yass lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has seven children, four of whom are still dependent on her. 

Yass has been doing her current businesses, which is rice farming and corn cultivating, for six years. Yass has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and successfully repaid the loans. The past loans have helped her relieve the burdens of her family and enabled her to see the improvement in her family’s living conditions. 

She is now leading a group of two members, including Phalla, who has also been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, to seek a new loan. As a leader, Yass will put her loan portion into purchasing fertilizer packages for her farmland. With the help of this loan, she believes that her current businesses will provide her with higher yields so that she can boost her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Pert

texts.en:
A resident from a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Pert is a 52-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She has earned a living through selling cakes for five years while her husband grows vegetable such as cabbages. chilies, and cucumbers to support the family. The current business earns them about 30,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day for future needs after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is still the main challenge for her.

Pert has been with VisionFund for four cycle. She fully repaid the past loan which have helped her better support her family with sufficient food. She is now applying for a loan with VisionFund of 4,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers for her vegetable planting and use a portion of it to buy a proper motorbike for her husband to complement the income by working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. She hopes this loan will enable her family to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her husband's vegetable planting

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Aged 54, Vann is married and lives with her family members in a rural area located in Battambang province's Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She has nine children, only one of whom is dependent and helps in the family's business. To support the big family, Vann and her husband have been working hard in rice farming and green pepper planting for more than twenty years. The main challenge for her family's business is lack of water to better support her crops.

Vann's group consists of two female members who live in the same village and they successfully repaid the past loans, which have helped them better support the family's living. Currently, Vann can earn about KHR 14,000 per day to meet the family's needs and manages to save about KHR 8,000 for future needs. Now she and her group member are applying for another loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a water pipe to carry water into her field. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crops and grow them healthily and fruitfully and also hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Pastorela Group

texts.es:
El grupo pastorela lo conforman tres socias trabajadoras y emprendedoras, la coordinadora es la señora Milagros que se   dedica a vender huesos y verduras en Tipitapa hace 25 años con el  crédito lo invertirá en hueso, chombom, mondongo, yuca, ayote…etc. además de eso ella tiene sembrada seis manzanas de verduras posee también 14 cerdos, 25 gallinas, 2 caballos con berlina.
Las otras integrantes son Eufemia quien vende comida y bebidas en su domicilio ; y Martha quien vende verduras  como repollo, tomate, limón, plátanos, cebollas etc.
texts.en: The group Pastorela (pastoral) is composed of three hardworking and self-starting partners. The coordinator is Milagros who has been selling bones and vegetables from Tipitapa for 25 years. With the loan she will invest in bones, pepper, tripe, yucca, squash etc. She also has sown six plots (size of 6 city blocks) of vegetables and owns 14 pigs, 25 hens, and 2 horses. The other members include Eufemia that sells food and drinks in her home and Martha that sells vegetables such as cabbage, tomatos, lemons, bananas, onions and other items.

loans.use: to purchase meat, pepper, bones, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is living in a wooden house in a rural area in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 23 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Growing corn and chilies on two hectares of farmland is the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for several years. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field. 

This is the first micro loan for Sophea with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy seeds and pesticides for her plantation and pay for labor fees. She hopes that with this loan, she will have a better crop yield so she can sell it for a good price and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Hurma

texts.en:
Hurma is a 64-year old woman who has been active in livestock and agriculture and sustained her business for 15 years. She lives in her rural home in south central Albania with her youngest and unmarried children. All of her children have now finished their education.

Hurma has requested a loan of 150,000 Albania Leke (ALL) from VisionFund Albania to help her finish a newly built house, before the winter starts. She says that if they stayed at the current old place, they would suffer during the wintertime because all the rain and cold would come in. 
 
Hurma hopes that her hard work and Kiva lenders' understanding and financial support will help her attain her goal to finish building her family home.

loans.use: To finish building her family home.

loans.name: Dude

texts.en:
Dude, 56, is married and illiterate. She lives with her husband and a young son who is married and has children. They live in northern Albania, a region with an extreme, cold climate and an economy that has developed lately thanks to tourism, agriculture and animal husbandry.

Dude has been working in livestock, where she learned the milk-producing business 15 years ago. She puts long hours of hard work into it every day of the week, as does her husband. Dude approached VisionFund Albania because she found out about the support it gives the rural sector and decided to request a loan to build a stable for her animals in order to keep them warm during the wintertime. 

In the future, Dude hopes to finish building her new family home that she started sometime back; yet, for now she is focused on building the stable, and she seeks lenders' appreciation in this matter.

loans.use: To rebuild a damaged animal stable.

loans.name: Hysni

texts.en:
Hysni, 55, is a rural villager in central Albania. He is the father of nine children, four of them dependent children including one who is suffering from illness. Hysni and his wife have been engaged in livestock and agriculture farming as a main income source for 20 years. Hysni previously worked in the mining industry. With their current business, Hysni and his wife are able to make enough money to feed their family. 

With a lack of money for their business, Hysni is applying for his third loan with VisionFund Albania. He will use this loan to buy fodder for his livestock and also enable him to stock up the feed before the winter starts. Should they save some money through their business this year, they will take the child for treatments and other therapies.

Hysni and his wife would very much appreciate lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy fodder for livestock.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita, 33, is married and educated, yet despite her education, she hasn’t been able to find a job in her field. As such, she has been working in the agriculture industry for about 10 years now. She lives with her husband and looks after her brother who suffers from serious illness and lives with them. They live in a rural village in the central eastern part of the country where the economy lately has improved thanks to agriculture and livestock.

Merita works long hours every day of the week in animal husbandry. At times she feels exhausted ”yet, I feel I’ve got no other choices,” she explains. Earlier in the month of September, Merita approached VisionFund Albania to request a loan to buy feed for her livestock. She has requested loans from the same institution and repaid them on time. 
 
Merita hopes to get support from lenders at Kiva.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en: Soeurn, a mother of five children, is 52 years old and a resident of Moung Russey district, Banteay Meanchey province. She deals with her family's hardship by growing rice on two hectares of farmland and also by raising pigs as extra income. She has been in business for 30 years and it enables her to generate about 20,000 KHR per day. Soeurn took her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) four cycles ago. She has well-managed her loan in a smart manner in order to sustain both of her businesses and to relieve her family's burden. Now, she is in a group of two female members and her co-member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Currently, she and her fellow group member are applying for 800,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR loans respectively. As a group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm and a portion of it to buy pig feed. She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her cash crop on time so she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pig feed for her farm.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Savong

texts.en: Savong, an inhabitant originally from Kampong Cham province's Dambae district, is 33 years old and married. He covers his daily expenses by selling soup and gasoline. For the two years that he has been engaged in this business, he has been able to earn about 8.5 US dollars per day. Savong has been with VisionFund, a partner of Kiva, for one cycle and has paid back his entire loan with success. Now, he feels empowered that he can attain better living conditions for his family. Hence, he is seeking a new loan in amount of 500 US dollars in order to buy more gasoline for resale and additional items for supporting his soup-selling business such as a big casserole, cooker, firewood, etc. He hopes that he will attract more customers so as he can improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline for resale and material for supporting a soup-selling business.

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en: Savoeurn is a 32-year-old mother of four school children. She meets the daily basic needs of her household by growing cassava on a one-hectare plot of farmland and growing beans on another one-hectare plot. She has been involved in this business for six years. As a new cycle loan client, Savoeurn formed a group composed of three female members. She and one of her co-members are first-time borrowers while the third member is a second-time borrower. All of them are seeking the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Savoeurn will use her loan portion to buy insecticide for her bean plantation. She hopes to double her yield so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy insecticide for her bean plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar,la socia vende peluches,adornos entre otros regalos,al socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de cuyes,en el negocio de bazar la socia se dedica 7 años en este negocio y en el negocio de crianza de cuyes se dedica a 5 años,por medio de estos negocios la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de bazar.La socia solicita el credito para comprar peluches,adornos y regalos para implementar su bazar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues working at her shop, selling stuffed animals and decorations, among other gifts. She also works raising guinea pigs.  She has worked for 7 years in her shop, and for 5 years raising guinea pigs.  Through these businesses she hopes to raise her children.  Her dream is to expand her shop.  She is requesting the loan to buy stuffed animals, decorations and gifts with which to stock her shop.  She is happy about the loan and she promises to comply with the payments on her account,.

loans.use: : the member is requesting a loan to buy stuffed aniimals, decorations and gifts to supply her store.

loans.name: Sothun's Group

texts.en: Sothon, a young 28-year-old married woman, is the mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. She is a farmer who grows soybeans, corn, and vegetables in order for her household to survive. Her husband supplements the family's income via working as a blacksmith. The main challenge for her is the shortage of water supply which declines her yield. This is the fourth cycle for Sothon's group, consisting of three female members. The success of her past three loans that she has paid back have helped her to better support her household as well as her cash-crop growing business. Now, she is the leader of her group loan. All members are not only in the same loan cycle with Kiva's partner (VisionFund) but also are requesting a new loan in the same amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. For Sothon, this loan portion will be used to buy seed (soybean and cucumber), one sack of fertilizer, and insecticide. She hopes to boost her yield to be more profitable so that she can keep her children until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy seed (soy-bean and cucumber), one sack of fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Horolsuren

texts.en: Horolsuren is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son, in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He is married to Tsetegbadam, who is 25 years old, and stays at home with their son. Horolsuren conducted a water well drilling business in 2006-2008. He gave this business to his mother. Since 2008, he has been running a tire repair service business. He bought a motorcycle with his business profits in 2012. Now he is requesting 3,900,000 MNT to buy tires from Ulaanbaatar for his tire repair business. He is a hardworking and responsible person.

loans.use: To buy tires from Ulaanbaatar for his tire repair business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Martha from Moriba town,a southern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married, with 3 children between the ages of 12 and 20.  Her children are currently attending school, and she also has two relatives at home. She used the funds to buy the tie-dye material.

Martha runs a tie-dye business at her home; she sells traditional pattern design clothes, wax cotton and dye. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business from 6:00 am to 7:30 pm, and her business is the only income she has. She says her business is doing well.

Martha has requested a loan in order to buy traditional pattern design clothes, wax cotton and dye.   The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare, and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to build a big shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy traditional pattern design clothes, wax cotton and dye.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Kadiatu from Kandeh town, Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 10 years and 20 years. Three of her children are attending school. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough to support the 6 children.  She began this business because she needs to generate income to support her family.

She runs a food stand business within a busy market area. She sells rice and grand nuts. She has been running this business for 30 years. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week.  Her business is the only income she has. She says her business is doing well and customers are coming. 

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more rice, oil, Maggie and onions. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, Maggie and onions.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: A farmer originally from Kror Kor district, Sor is 33 years old and has two dependent children. For daily decent food for her children, she grows paddy rice and vegetables. She has had experience in this business for 12 years and is able to earn about 11,000 KHR per day. Her key challenge is the low production where the flood occurs. For this cycle, Sor is a second-time borrower with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The original loan, which she has paid back completely, has helped her to sustain her business gradually and better support her household. Therefore, she was able to manage to buy a decent motorbike for commuting and shipping her vegetables. Now, she wants to expand her business. Hence, she formed a group of three female members to seek a microloan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her paddy field and vegetable garden. She hopes to double her income and therefore attain good progress on her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her paddy field and vegetable garden

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the cost of labor for his farm

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe A Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  est le membre et le président du groupe Abishyizehamwe A. Le nom du groupe signifie «ceux qui sont ensemble pour le développement ».Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 2 an à 5 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est 6ième primaire.

Emmanuel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autres crédits pour renforcer ses activités de l’agriculture de riz et utiliser des semences sélectionner. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait avoir beaucoup des dépôts de riz dans sa région et être le meilleur producteur de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et assurance maladies de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member and the president of the group Abishyizehamwe A. The group’s name means “those who come together for development”. He is a 28-year-old married father of two children aged 2 and 5. He attended 6 years of primary school.

Emmanuel is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB, and he says that the previous loans helped his activity considerably and he did not anticipate any difficulties with repayment. He plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor. 

Emmanuel's business growth strategy is to obtain additional loans to strengthen his activity, and to use specially selected seeds. In the coming years, he would like to own numerous storage facilities in his region and become the leading rice farmer. He plans to use his profits to pay for his children’s tuition and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Ongeringufu Dukore / Mshs Group

texts.fr:
Drocelle est le membre et la présidente du groupe Ongeringufu dukore. Le nom du groupe signifie «Augmenter des forces et travaillons».Elle a 42 ans et elle est mariée avec 9 enfants de 3ans  à 23 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Drocelle est agricultrice de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour préparer des champs des riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, elle planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour renforcer ses activités de l’agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et payer l’assurance maladies de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Drocelle is a member and the president of the group Ongeringufu dukore. The group's name means "Increase ours forces and let's work". She is 42 years old and married, and she has nine children, from 3 to 23 years old. Four of the children are in school. She has a 6th grade education.

Drocelle is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is her second one with the microfinance institution ACB. She is going to use her loan to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor for preparing rice fields.

To increase her rice farming, she plans on requesting more loans to bolster her farm business. In the next few years, she would like to be the best rice producer in her region. With the profits, she plans on covering the schooling costs for her children and to pay for their health insurance.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor for her rice fields

loans.name: Savuot's Group

texts.en:
A permanent resident from Srey Snom district (Cambodia), Savuot is 48 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are students. The main source of the family's income is rice farming, from which she is able to earn about 6,000 KHR per day. It is the only business that she has been with for 12 years. For her business, drought remains the main challenge. 

As a third-time borrower with VisionFund, Savuot is also a group leader in a group of two. She has wisely managed her past loan to better support her household and business. Additionally, she can manage a mini-tracker and start up a new business, pig raising, in order to earn an extra income. 

Now, she and her co-member are seeking the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. For Savuot, she will use this loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee. She expects that this purchase will boost her crop productivity so that she can double her income and keep uplifting her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, a mother of three schoolchildren, is 30 years and a resident from Kror Kor district's Pursat province. She and her husband maintains daily basic needs for the entire household via rice cultivation on two hectares of farmland and a pig-raising business. She can earn almost 10,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for 13 years. Never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, she and her joint member are taking a loan as a first-time loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As a group leader, Chreb is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this purchase will return her a good yield, so she can keep all of her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio es comerciante de un negocio familiar en el mercado municipal de la ciudad donde vende productos veterianarios; es un joven responsable, honesto y muy trabajador, trabaja en conjunto con su esposa, quien le apoya con los gastos familiares y el cuido de la familia.  son una familia honesta, reconocida y muy querida en el municipio.   Solicita su crèdito  para comprar una computadora con sus accesorios y asi poder llevar un inventario y control de las entradas y salidas del negocio.   Su sueño es que sus hijos  gozen de salud, mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y que no les falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is a merchant who works for a family-owned business at the municipal market of the city.  He sells veterinarian products and is a responsible, honest, hard-working young man.  He works together with is wife who helps cover family expenses and care for the family.  They are an honest, respected, well-loved family in the town.  

He is requesting a loan to buy a computer and accessories to control inventory and business transactions.  His goal is for his children to have good health, to renovate his house and to cover all the the basic needs of a household.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his business.

loans.name: Celfita

texts.es:
Celfita, de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, buena y que sacrifica todo por sus tres hijos de 12, 8 y 4 años, a quienes tiene que educar y alimentar sola pues ella es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hijos, sus padres y un hermano quien tiene también su familia viviendo ahí.
Celfita tiene un trabajo que consiste en la venta ambulatoria de bolsas, todos los días se levanta temprano y se va a los mercados a ofrecer bolsas para el despacho de productos, trabaja en los mercados más cercanos a su casa o en las calles más transitadas de la ciudad en donde tiene un buen mercado de clientes, es muy querida ya que es carismática y sabe cómo tratar a sus clientes. Tiene 9 años en este trabajo y lo hace sola ya que sus hijos aun estudian y le apoyan solo algunas horas. Le gusta su trabajo porque tiene tiempo libre que le brinda independencia y libertad para realizar otras funciones, ella sabe que de su trabajo depende la sostenibilidad de su familia, es por eso que sigue adelante a pesar de las adversidades, afortunadamente tiene clientes fijos que consolidó con el paso del tiempo y que le permite tener buenas ganancias, espera seguir progresando económicamente ya que le permitirá mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, además quisiera tener un local para vender de manera mas formal. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará mas bolsas de plástico para continuar vendiendo a sus clientes quienes le solicitan de mayores tamaño y de diferentes calidades.
texts.en:
Celfita, 45, is a hard-working, good mother who sacrifies everything for her three children, ages 12, 8 and 4, and educates and feeds on her own, as she is a single mother.  She and her children live with her parents and a brother who also has his family living there.

Celfita is a street vendor and sells bags.  Every day she gets up early and goes to the market to offer bags to shoppers.  She works in the markets closest to her home or in the crowded streets where there are many customers.  She is very loved because of her charisma and good customer service.  She has been in this business for nine years and works alone since the children are still in school, even though they do help her sometimes.  What she likes about her work is that she has free time, is independent and can do other things.  She knows that her work is the only income for the family, so she must get ahead despite any adversity.  Fortunately, she has fixed customers that she has gained over time so she earns a good profit.  She wants to continue progressing economically to give her family a better lifestyle.  She would also like to have her own stall to make her sales more formal.  

This is her fourth loan through MFP, so she is grateful to the people who are giving her this opportunity for financial help, because this gives her the confidence to advance in her work.
