texts.en: Carlos Rene is 30 years old and single. He didn't have the opportunity to study. He works running a store. He started this business because he noticed that there was no store in his community and he had the chance to improve his income. He organized a group to be able to apply for a loan, which he will use to buy products to expand the store that he has. He will buy carbonated water, juice, sweets, and other things that sell well in his store. In the future, he hopes to have a large place on the side of the road, to have more customers. The other members work in trade. One of the men in the photo did not qualify for a loan.

loans.use: to buy products for the store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 44 años, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene seis hijos de 25, 24, 20, 19, 16 y 9 años, aún viven a su lado aunque no todos dependen totalmente de ella para su alimentación y educación, ella tiene una casa propia donde vive junto a sus seis hijos y su cónyuge, trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Lucila consiste en la venta de comida. Tiene su propio local que consiguió tras muchos años de esfuerzo. Se inició vendiendo en la vereda de su casa en donde instalaba una mesa, un par de sillas y una modesta cocina y a diario atendía a sus ocasionales comensales. Actualmente, tiene un amplio local con mayor cantidad de mesas y donde ofrece mayor variedad de platillos que caracterizan la cocina peruana. Anteriormente trabajaba sola y hoy por hoy tiene trabajaba al lado de dos personas más junto a tu pareja. Lleva trabajando 2 años y está contenta por que le está yendo bien y así puede generar ganancias considerables para el mantenimiento de los gastos básicos de su hogar. Le gusta su trabajo ya que por las mañanas puede utilizar parte de su tiempo para otras actividades fundamentales en su hogar y otras funciones que también son necesarias para el funcionamiento de su negocio. Por fortuna tiene clientes todos los días ya que está ubicada en un lugar muy accesible para el público y esto le permite incrementar sus ingresos a diario y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, aún se encuentra en proceso de expansión y de remodelación de su establecimiento y espera culminarlo a mediano plazo. Este es el crédito número 13 con MFP, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, asimismo se siente cómoda perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos, utensilios y bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas para continuar con su trabajo ya que desea mantener su clientela contenta y atenderlos mejor.
texts.en:
Lucila, 44, is in a committed relationship with her partner with whom she has six children who are 25, 24, 20, 19, 16 and 9 years of age. They all live with her although not all of them depend on her entirely for their food and schooling. She has her own home where she lives with her six children and partner. She works a lot to provide a better quality of life for her family. Lucila's work consists of food sales. She has her own location which she obtained after many years of effort. She started off selling from the sidewalk in front of her house where she set up a table, a pair of chairs and a modest cooking appliance where she attended daily to the customers who would happen by to eat. 

Currently she has a commodious location with a large number of tables where she offers a greater variety of dishes characteristic of Peruvian cuisine. Formerly she worked alone and these days she has two additional persons working alongside her as well as her husband. She's been working for two years and is happy because it is going well for her and so she is able to generate a considerable income for supporting her household with its basic expenses. She likes her work since in the mornings she is able to use part of her time for other primary activities in her home and handle other functions that are also necessary for the functioning of her business. 

Fortunately she has customers every day since she is located in a highly accessible spot for the public. This allows her to increase her earnings daily and provide better living conditions for her family. She is still in the process of expanding and remodeling her establishment and hopes to finish within the medium term. This is her 13th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support that guarantees her ability to continue working with much assurance. She for her part commits to continue being a prompt member with her payments as she has done with previous loans she had. Likewise she feels comfortable belonging to her communal bank since all of its members are very responsible and mutually supportive. 

With the requested amount of 2,500 Peruvian soles she will purchase ingredients, supplies, utensils and drinks such as soft drinks and beer in order to continue her work, since she wishes to keep her customers happy and better attend to them.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, supplies, utensils and drinks such as soft drinks and beer so she may continue her work.

loans.name: Patricia Abigail

texts.es:
La socia Patricia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de joyas como artes,collares,pulseras todos estos hechos en plata,la socia cuenta con un local para vender su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

  
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia como aretes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Patricia belongs to the “Comuzone I” communal bank and continues with her business selling jewelry like earrings, necklaces and bracelets; all made of silver.  She has a locale where she sells her goods to customers that request them.   She’s been in business for a good length of time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  She’s a responsible, determined person who supports her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy merchandise like earrings for her business.  She’s grateful for the loan granted and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like earrings for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de accesorios para celulares,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende baterias,cargadores entre otros,la socia trabaja de lunes a domingo durante el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de baterias y para comprar algunos viveres para su hogar como arroz y leche.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She’s a member of the “Comuzone I” communal bank and continues with her business selling mobile phone accessories.  She’s been in business for a good length of time and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  She sells batteries and chargers, among others.  She works Monday to Sunday during the day.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She’s requests the loan to buy batteries and also to buy some groceries like rice and milk for her home.  She is grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy batteries and to buy some groceries like rice and milk for her home.

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Patricia Maribel tiene 26 años de edad es casada y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de turismo,la socia hace servicio de guia hacia lugares de machupicchu u otros lugares turisticos,la socia tambien vende tickes para vender a los turisticas,la socia ya se dedica 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener una agencia de viajes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tickes,boletos turisticos y carpas para implementar su trabajo de guia de turismo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Patricia Maribel, 26, is married and has a son.  She works in tourism.  She works as a tour guide to places like Machu Picchu and other tourist attractions.  She also sells tickets to tourists.  She’s been in business six years and her dream is to have a travel agency.  She requests the loan to buy tickets, tourist passes and tents to equip her tourist guide business.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy tickets, tourist passes and tents.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece la banco comunal COMUZONE I,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de verduras,la socia vende zanahorias,tomates,cebollas entre otros,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco ,la socia trabaja de lunes a domingo durante el dia,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que ella saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Comuzone I” communal bank and continues with her business selling vegetables.  She sells carrots, tomatoes and onions, among others.  She sells them in one of Cusco’s markets Monday to Sunday all day.  She’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into it.  She’s a responsible person who supports her family this way.  She’s asking for the loan to buy carrots at wholesale.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy carrots at wholesale.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Benon is a hardworking man who deals in dry produce, a business he has run for a period of three years. He started this enterprise with the proceeds from maize and beans growing. He says inadequate capital is the main factor affecting the business.

Benon is requesting a loan to buy maize, rice and beans to sell. He would like to buy a car to transport the produce to bigger markets in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize, rice and beans  to sell.

loans.name: Garasiano

texts.en:
Garasiano is a 32-year-old gentleman who deals in a produce business which he has run for a period of four years. He started this business with capital derived from the transport business that he still operates. He says inadequate capital is the major factor affecting the venture.

Garasiano is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell. He would like to build a permanent house for his family and venture into modern farming methods instead of buying from other farmers in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for ten years. He also earns an additional income from grazing animals. He normally operates in market stalls of different markets around the region. He hopes to expand his business into the city despite challenges of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. Noah intends to use the money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,el socio continua con su negocio de venta de ropa ,el socio viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercaderia como pantalones,casacas,polos entre otros como tambien le mandan su mercaderia para que el pueda recibirlo aca mismo,el socio cuenta con un local donde vende su mercaderia  a sus clientes que le solicitan,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercadera como casacas.
El socio se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: He belongs to the “Comuzone I” communal bank and continues with his business selling clothes.  He travels every so often to Lima to buy merchandise like pants, coats and polo shirts, among others and sometimes the merchandise is shipped to him too.  He has a locale where he sells his goods to customers that request them.  He’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into his business every day.  He’s a responsible, determined person who supports his family this way.  He’s requesting the loan to buy merchandise like coats.  He feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his established installment payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like coats.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling maize flour for six years and his business is located in the trading centre. He hopes to educate his children up to the University and renovate his residential house. His challenge is competition from wholesale traders who buy from farmers directly and eliminate him. Godfrey is requesting money to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Rina Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rina Elena se dedica al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende tejido,chompas y carteras,la socia vende en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia hace trabajos de artesania como ella teje chompas y tambien carteras,la socia se dedica al negocio 5 años,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la artesania.La solicita el credito para comprar lanas de colores y palitos de tejr al por mayor.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Reina Elena works selling crafts.  She sells knitwear, sweaters and purses in various street markets in Cusco.  She makes handicrafts; she knits sweaters and purses.  She’s been in business five years and her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her crafts.  She requests a loan to buy yarn in assorted colors and knitting needles at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy yarn in assorted colors and knitting needles at wholesale.

loans.name: Qurbonbi

texts.ru: Курбонби жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Курбонби портниха, она более десяти лет занимается шитьем. Курбонби в основном занимается шитьем национальных платьев у себя дома. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки и покупки тканей.
texts.en: Qurbonbi is a resident of the Gissar district.  She is 41 years old, married and has five children.  Qurbonbi is a seamstress.  She has been involved in sewing for over ten years.  Qurbonbi primarily makes national dresses at home.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, children's clothes, women's, men's and children's shoes and home appliances.

loans.name: Abdumubin

texts.ru:
Абдумубин житель города Исфара. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Абдумубина работает организации "Баракат". Сам Абдумубин имеет средне – специальное образование. По специальности он строитель и кафельщик. Абдумубин работает по специальности. Он предоставляет свои услуги жителям города уже четыре года. 
Абдумубин просит кредит для приобретения стройматериалов.
texts.en: Abdumubin is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 31 years old, married and has three children.  His wife works at the "Barakat" organization.  Abdumubin has a secondary-specialized education.  He is a construction worker and a tile installer.  Abdumubin works in his field.  He has been providing his services to the city's residents for four years.  Abdumubin is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sayfiddin

texts.ru: Сайфиддин проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена Сайфиддина домохозяйка. Сам он строитель. Он зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. В этой области Сайфиддин уже пять лет. Он берет кредит для покупки стройматериалов.
texts.en: Sayfiddin lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 30 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Sayfiddin is a construction worker.  He earns a living by doing contractor work.  Sayfiddin has been in this field for five years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sahob

texts.ru: Сахоб проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Сахоб занимается купле – продажей сухофруктов. Торговлей он занимается 25 лет. Сахоб хочет расширить свою деятельность. Он просит кредит для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Sahob lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 56 years old, married and has four children.  Sahob is involved in buying and selling dried fruits.  He has been in sales for 25 years.  Sahob wants to expand his business.  He is requesting this loan to purchase dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru:
Зулайхо добрая и дружелюбная женщина. Ей 43 года. Она проживает в городе Куляб. Зулайхо вдова. Она является матерью двоих детей. Зулайхо рядом с областной больницей открыла небольшую столовую, где работает поваром. В этой области она уже два года. Вместе с ней в столовой работает ее дочь, она помогает своей матери. 
Зулайхо просит кредит для приобретения нового помещения, чтобы продолжить и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zulaykho is a kind and friendly woman.  She is 43 years old and lives in the city of Kulob.  Zulaykho is a widow.  She is a mother of two children.  Zulaykho opened a small cafeteria near the district hospital and works as a cook there.  She has been in this field for two years.  Her daughter works with her at the cafeteria and helps her mother.  Zulaykho is requesting this loan to purchase a new space in order to continue and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new space in order to continue and expand her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 29 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora, es conviviente con Atilio de 44 años y tiene tres hijos, Víctor de 22, Lucy de 18 y el engreído de la casa Alex de solo 4 años, ella vive a lado de su familia en su casa propia y trabaja mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a cada uno de ellos. El trabajo de Lucy consiste en la venta de bebidas, tiene un proveedor que se encarga de llevarle los pedidos a su casa, realizó un convenio con esa empresa que le da a precio mayorista y le deja desde bebidas gaseosas hasta bebidas alcohólicas que lógicamente ella vende solo a personas con mayoría de edad, además tiene el arte de la decoración en sus manos y lo aprovecha vendiendo postres. Lleva realizando su trabajo por más de 4 años y lo hace sola. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, se siente a gusto pudiendo repartir su tiempo entre las actividades de su casa, sus hijos y su negocio, está muy contenta de tener tan buenos ingresos ya que le permite pensar en ampliar su negocio y poner una fuente de soda que está segura lo hará mas adelante. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la preparación de sus postres, además comprará bebidas de todo tipo, marca y presentación ya que desea incrementar su stock de ventas.
texts.en:
Lucy, 29, is a good, kind, hardworking woman.  She lives with Atilio, 44, and has three children: Víctor, 22, Lucy, 18 and the quite spoiled, four-year-old, Alex.  She lives with her family in her own house and works hard to provide each one of them with a better quality of life.  

Lucy’s work consists in selling beverages.  She has a supplier who delivers her orders to her house.  She made an agreement with this firm which gives her wholesale prices and delivers beverages ranging from soft-drinks to alcoholic beverages which logically she only sells to adults.  She also has very skilled hands so she applies her skills to selling desserts.  She’s been in business four years and she works alone.  She enjoys her work very much and feels good being able to divide her time between her household chores, her children and her business.  She’s very happy to earn such good income because it allows her to think about expanding her business and opening a soda fountain; she’s convinced that she’ll do it later on.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s happy about the financial support she’s being offered because she’ll feel more confident about advancing with her work.  On the other hand, she commits to continue making her installment payments as scheduled.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy ingredients and supplies to continue making her desserts and will buy beverages of various types, brands and presentations because she wants to increase stock.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her desserts and also to buy all types of beverages.

loans.name: Luceros De Patachaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta casada, tiene 33 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica al bordado de blusas y guipiles, inicio este negocio como empleada, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción de casas.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos de varios colores y clases, en el futuro espera tener un puesta de venta en el mercado y mas operarios para su negocio. Las demás integrantes se dedican al bordados de blusas y guipiles, producción de sabanas y servilletas típicas.
texts.en:
Maria is married, 33 years old, and while she never had the opportunity to receive an education, she has one child who is currently studying. She works embroidering blouses and huipiles, a traditional garment. She started out in this business as an employee and now has 10 years experience. She relies on the help of her husband who works in home construction. 

She organized a group in order to apply for a loan which will be used to purchase fabrics and threads of various types and colors. In the future she hopes to have her own shop in the market and to hire workers for her business. The other members also work embroidering blouses and huipiles and making linens and traditional kerchiefs.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
Marlith, tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, es soltera y madre de 2 hijos a quienes cuida con mucho esmero y a ellos a les dedica todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante y mejorar día a día su condición de vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre e hijos y junto a ellos lucha por salir adelante. Nuestra amiga Marlith se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y otros productos como gelatina, hielo y “chupetes” elaborados con frutas tropicales. Tiene una refrigeradora heredada que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo y anteriormente solo lo usaba para guardar todo lo que empleaba en su alimentación semanal, sin embargo, la necesidad de generar sus ingresos la llevaron a utilizarlo dentro de su actividad económica y ahora le sirve como un apoyo en su economía. Lleva en esta actividad más de 10 años y afortunadamente le va bien ya que diariamente recibe buenas ganancias. Trabaja sola ya que para cumplir esta función no necesita ayuda. Sin embargo, también vende comida y ahí si recibe el apoyo de su madre y de sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la atención, lavado de utensilios, cobranzas, etc. Vende en la vereda de su casa desde hace 8 años y siempre termina todo lo que diariamente pone a la venta. Le esta yendo muy bien en lo que hace ya que al tener dos actividades también genera doble ingresos a su hogar y con eso puede brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, porque de ésta forma hace más amena sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Más adelante espera poder construir un local más grande donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable, está muy contenta de continuar con este grupo ya que son muy cumplidos y amables.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará ingredientes para continuar con su negocio de venta de comida, además comprará gaseosas y gelatina para seguir vendiendo sus productos en su casa.
texts.en:
Marlith, 40, is a kind, hardworking woman.  She’ single and the mother of two children she cares for with much dedication; she focuses all her efforts on them to get ahead and improve their daily living conditions.  She lives in her own house with her mother and children and strives alongside them to get ahead.

Marlith sells soft-drinks and other products like gelatin treats, ice and ‘chupetes’ [frozen treats] made from tropical fruit.  She has an inherited refrigerator she was able to buy with much effort.  She used to use it just to store what she used for her weekly meals but the need to earn income led her to use it for her economic activity and now it helps her earn income.

She’s been in business 10 years and fortunately does well since she earns good daily profits.  She works alone because she doesn’t need help to do this work.  However, she also sells food and her mother does help her with this activity and her children help her take care of customers, wash utensils, and collect payment.

She’s been selling outside her house for the last 8 years and always sells out everything she prepares daily for sale.  She’s doing very well because having two activities generates double household income and this allows her to provide better living conditions for her family.  What she likes best about her work is chatting with the customers because this makes the long work day more pleasant.  Later on she plans to build a larger locale to provide better customer service.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s very excited and grateful for the economic backup she’s being offered to continue with her plans.  She doesn’t want to miss paying for it for lack of money which is why she commits to be very punctual and above all very responsible.  She’s very happy to continue in this group because they are very responsible and kind.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy ingredients to continue with her food business and will also buy soft-drinks and gelatin treats to continue selling at home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, soft-drinks and gelatin snacks.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.es: Nuri, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer joven, alegre, dinámica y con muchos deseos de superación, convive con Rildo y junto a él tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años, vive a lado de ellos en su propia casa que lograron construir con muchos esfuerzo, ahí comparten sus días llenos de amor y de grandes deseos de progreso. La actividad que realiza Nuri es la venta de abarrotes, estableció su negocio en su propia casa en donde tiene instalado los enseres necesarios para exhibir todos los productos que pone a la venta como leche, huevos, enlatados, harinas, fideos, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros. Todos los días atiende a su clientela desde muy temprano con mucha cordialidad y amabilidad. Realiza la compra de los artículos de manera semanal o cada dos días y en cada compra puede invertir alrededor de 500 a 800 soles. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 4 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su cónyuge. Le agrada sus actividades ya que le permiten tener una ocupación en casa y tener tiempo libre para poder atender a  sus hijos, se siente bien generando ingresos adicionales que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Por otro lado, viendo que le está yendo bien con su negocio tiene planes de continuar desarrollándolo e incrementar la variedad de sus productos. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500), comprará mayor variedad de los principales abarrotes que  tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes como arroz, azúcar, huevos y leche.
texts.en:
Nuri, 32, is a young, cheerful, dynamic woman who very much wants to improve.  She lives with Rildo and they have two children who are 7 and 4 years old.  She lives with them in her own house that they managed to build with much effort.  They share their days there filled with love and great hopes for progress.

Nuri’s activity is selling groceries.  She opened her store at home where she has shelves installed to display all the products she sells like milk, eggs, canned goods, flour, noodles, soft-drinks, rice, sugar and oil, among others.  She tends to customers kindly and cordially every day starting very early.  She buys her merchandise either weekly or every two days and can spend between 500 and 800 soles each purchase.

She’s been in business four years and sometimes her spouse helps her.  She likes her activity because it allows her to have a home-based occupation and have free time to take care of her children.  She feels good generating additional income to help her spouse with household expenses.  On the other hand, seeing that she’s doing well with the store she plans to continue developing it and increasing the variety of her stock merchandise.

This is her second MFP loan so she’s grateful to all the people that make her loan possible to continue working with the best possible results.  On the other hand, she commits once more to make her installment payments punctually like she’s done with her previous loan.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsibly, very supportive people.  She will use the requested 500 soles to buy a larger variety of the main groceries that are in highest demand like rice, sugar, eggs and milk.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Martiza Marlene

texts.es: La Señora Maritza Marlene habitante de Col, San Miguel, desde su pequeñez se ha dedicado al trabajo del campo, realizando actividades agricolas y pecuarias, las cuales se convierten en su principal  fuente de trabajo y las que le generan  ingreso economico, trabaja en conjunto con su compañero de vida y dos hijos mayores en su unidad de produccion, requiere de este financiamiento para invertirlo en establecimiento de 1.5 Mzs del cultivo de Yuca, actividad que realizara con un buen manejo tecnico, esperando incrementar la produccion de dicho cultivo y fortalecer su economia, referencias la consideran como una persona  trabajadora, responsable y de buenas culturas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Marlene lives in the Colonia San Miguel. Since her childhood, she has worked in the fields doing agricultural work and tending to livestock.  She converted these skills into her main employment and source of income.  She works with her life partner and two older children as a production group.
Their production requires funding to invest in approximately 1.5 acres of yuca / cassava plants. The harvest requires good technical planning with the hopes of increasing the production and strengthening economic gains.  Their references consider them to be hardworking, responsible and well regarded.

loans.use: to cultivate yuca / cassava plants

loans.name: José Rául

texts.es:
Don José tiene 52  años de edad, es padre soltero de dos hijos. Desde su juventud se dedica a la agricultura, sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo, cultiva hortalizas como sandias y maíz. Los insumos agrícolas los compra en una ciudad que esta a ocho kilómetros de su casa, se transporta en autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres sacos de fertilizantes para 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y otros 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de sandia. Necesita mucho los insumos, porque en este momento sus cultivos requieren de los fertilizantes y no tiene el dinero para comprarlos por si mismo. Con la inversión, espera recibir una cosecha mayor, para que sus ingresos sean mejores y poder ayudar a los gastos del hogar. Con los ingresos que reciba este año espera cultivar más el próximo año, asegurando la alimentación de sus hijos y de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 52, is a single father of two children.  He’s worked in agriculture since his youth; his parents taught him the occupation.  He grows vegetables like watermelon and corn.  He buys his farm supplies in a city that’s 8 kilometers from home; he travels by bus.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy three sacks of fertilizer for 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of watermelon.  He very much needs the supplies because his crops need fertilizing now and he does not have money to buy them.  With the investment he hopes to produce a larger harvest so that his income will be better and it can help with household expenses.  Income he earns this year will allow him to plant more next year insuring his children’s and his family’s food.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Norma Vie

texts.es: Norma de 42 años es madre soltera de una jovencita de 26 años, trabaja embarcada en un crucero hace seis años en atención al cliente y da clases de bayle, cada seis meses vuelve al país a ver a su familia, Norma es originaria de la Costa Caribe del país, de donde se vio con la necesidad de venir a la capital para que su hija estudie una carrera universitaria. Solicita un segundo crédito para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que necesita comprar perlines, sinc, cemento, bloques, hierro, alambre, madera para renglones, sus planes a futuro es terminar de construir su casa y poner una tienda con mucha variedad para sus hijas y sus nietos por quienes trabaja.
texts.en: Norma is 42 years old and is the single mother of a 26 year old young woman.  She has worked on a cruise ship for six years, giving dancing lessons to clients.  She returns to the country to visit her family every six months.   Norma is originally from the Caribbean coastal part of the country and saw the need to go to the capital city so that her daughter could study at university.  She is asking for a second loan so that she could add a room to her house and she needs girders, zinc metal sheeting, cement, cinder blocks, iron bars, wire, and lumber.  Her future plans are to finish building her house and set up a store with lots of variety for her daughter and grandchildren for whom she works.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Fautino

texts.es:
Don Fautino tiene 49  años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Desde que tenia 10 años, se dedica a la agricultura, fue su mamá quien le enseño, debido a que su papá se murió cuando él estaba muy pequeño; por lo que junto a su mamá les toco trabajar para sostener a la familia. Se levanta muy temprano para trabajar a las 4:00 a.m. a tomarse su taza de café y salir a las 5:00 a.m. para llegar al trabajo a las 6:00 a.m. debido a que camina a pie una hora, él lo hace con todo el corazón para que sus hijos se desarrollen. Los insumos para su trabajo los compra en una ciudad, aborda un autobús que tarda unos cuarenta y cinco minutos, luego aborda otro autobús que tarda otros cuarenta y cinco minutos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres sacos de fertilizantes, herbicidas y para pago de mano de obra. Con la inversión podrá suplir la necesidad de realizar sus cultivos, pues tendrá a la mano los insumos que necesita para que su cosecha sea productiva. Su deseo es trabajar, para ahorrar y comprar a sus hijos un lugar para construir su casa, ya que donde viven es muy pequeño y lo que quiere es cada uno de sus hijos tenga un lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Fautino, age 49, lives with his wife and their three children.  He has worked in agriculture ever since he was ten years old.  It was his mother who taught him because his father died when he was very little.  Therefore, it fell to his mother and him to work to support the family.

He gets up very early, at 4:00 a.m., to have a cup of coffee and then leave at 5:00 a.m.  He gets to work at 6:00 a.m. because he walks for an hour.  He does this wholeheartedly so that his children flourish.  He buys the supplies for his work in a city.  He gets on a bus for 45 minutes, then he gets on another bus for another 45 minutes.

The loan he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy three sacks of fertilizer, to buy herbicides, and to pay for labor.  With this investment he will be able to have what is needed to work with his crops.  He will have the supplies he needs on hand in order for his harvest to be productive.

His wish is to work in order to save and to buy a place to build a house for his children.  The place where they live is very small, and he wants each one of his children to have a place to live.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer, to buy herbicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 43 años, es una mujer emprendedora, dinámica y muy creativa, es madre soltera de un niño de 13 años quien es la razón de esfuerzo y sacrificio ya que de ella depende su educación y su alimentación, tiene su casa propia en donde vive junto a su padre y su hijo. Olga tiene un trabajo que consiste en la venta de yuca pero su principal ingreso económico radica en la venta del producto transformado de la harina de yuca que es la “fariña” (un producto regional muy consumido en la región). Para la elaboración de este producto necesita una gran cantidad de yuca que le produzca buenos kilos de “fariña”, en algunas temporadas de escasez de yuca compra esta materia prima en sacos al por mayor en los principales mercados y dependiendo de la cantidad que obtiene puede re-venderlos o usarlos para preparar la fariña. Algunas veces recibe pedidos de otras ciudades hasta donde transporta toda su mercadería en sacos de 50 kilos cada uno. Lleva trabajando por más de 7 años en esta actividad, lo hace sola y como tiene experiencia en el negocio siempre obtiene un buen producto. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que no tiene un horario definido por otras personas sino que ella misma organiza su agenda como lo considere necesario y así comparte su tiempo libre son su padre y su hijo, sabe que a sus clientes le gusta lo que ofrece así que se esmera en obtener un buen producto, le está yendo bien por ello espera más adelante poder ampliar su negocio vendiendo también otros productos regionales que tienen mucha demanda entre los pobladores de su región. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable, está muy contenta de continuar con este grupo ya que son muy cumplidos y amables. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas yuca para continuar con su trabajo, además lo utilizará para trasladarse a otras ciudades para negociar nuevas ventas.
texts.en:
Olga, 43, is an enterprising, dynamic, very creative woman.  She’s a single mother of a 13-year-old boy who is the reason for all her effort and sacrifice because his education and food depends on her.  She has her own house where she lives with her father and her son.  

Olga’s work consists in selling cassava root but her main income comes from selling it transformed into cassava flour, ‘fariña,’ which is a regional product that’s widely consumed in the region.  To make it one needs a large amount of cassava root in order to produce a good number of kilos of fariña.  When cassava root is seasonally scarce she buys this raw material in sacks at wholesale in the main markets and depending on the amount she’s able to buy she might resell it or use it to make fariña.  Sometimes she gets orders from other cities and transports her merchandise in 50-kilo sacks.  

She’s been in this business 7 years and works alone; since she has experience doing it she always obtains good product.  What she likes best about her work is that she does not have a work schedule that’s determined by others; she herself organizes her agenda as she sees fit thus sharing her time with her father and son.  She knows that her customers like what she sells so she strives to obtain good products.  She’s doing well so she hopes later on to expand the business and sell other regional products that are in high demand by residents of her region.

This is her 4th MFP loan and she’s very excited and grateful for the economic backup she’s being offered to continue with her plans.  She does not want to miss repaying it for lack of money so she commits to being very punctual and above all responsible.  She’s very happy to continue in this group because they are very responsible and kind.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more cassava root to continue with her work; she will also use it to travel to other cities to negotiate more sales.

loans.use: to buy cassava root and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: Don Guillermo tiene 48 años, trabaja en construcción, su esposa labora como domestica así ellos han sabido subsistir junto con su hijo de 10 años quien estudia en un colegio público. Esta es su primer experiencia en  trabajar con crédito, pero para él es una gran oportunidad porque puede realizar mejoras en su hogar; en este caso construir la parte de la cocina que está en muy malas condiciones, por lo que necesita comprar materiales de construcción como hierro, cemento, piedrines,  bloques, alambre y arena para empezar a levantar la obra, sus planes futuros es terminar de construir su casa y brindarle mayor espacio y comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 48 years old, works in construction, and his wife works as a domestic employee. Doing so, they learned how to survive with his son who is ten years old and is studying in a public school. This is his first experience working with credit, but for him it's a great opportunity because it will make improvements in his home.

In this case, he will build a part where the kitchen is, because it's in a very poor condition. He needs to buy construction materials such as iron, cement, gravel, blocks, wire and sand to start the work. His future plans are to finish building his home and provide more space and comfort to his family.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, gravel, piedrines, blocks, wire and sand.

loans.name: Naime

texts.en:
Naime, 47, is married and has one grownup child. She has been working in the livestock industry for about ten years and has been making delicious goat and sheep cheeses and salty/non-salty butter with the help of her husband and only child. They all live in a rural village in the central eastern part of the country, where the terrain and weather are a great help in the animal husbandry activity. 

Naime works hard for long hours every day of the week in the animal husbandry and producing dairy products business; yet, despite her exhaustion, she’s been content with the income she has been generating. In late September, Naime reached VisionFund Albania after she had decided to request a loan of 300,000 LEK to buy two cows; the previous two loans are successfully repaid.
  
Naime hopes to get support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add two milk cows to the existing goat and sheep herd

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es: Palmira, de 45 años, es una mujer luchadora, servicial y muy trabajadora, está divorciada del hombre que fue su pareja por muchos años, vive en su casa propia junto a dos de sus hijos quienes la apoyan siempre para seguir adelante. El trabajo de Palmira consiste en la venta diaria de gaseosas, agua mineral y jugos envasados de distintas marcas y sabores. Tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas instalado en su casa y desde ahí atiende todos los días a sus ocasionales clientes que mayormente son sus vecinos del barrio donde vive. Lleva más de 2 años en realizando este oficio y le va bien. En ocasiones a compartido esta actividad con la venta de algunos productos regionales como plátano, yuca o limones, las ganancias que este trabajo le ha brindado han sido muy buenas es por eso que quiere retomarlo y dedicarse permanente a ambas actividades que requieren de cierto capital para poder emprender esta nueva etapa. Le esta yendo muy bien en este negocio porque sus ganancias han aumentado gracias a la clientela que ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, anhela que su economía mejore aún más ya que desea vender nuevamente productos regionales y como consecuencia espera lograr que sus clientes sigan situándola como su vendedora favorita. Este es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1200), comprará bebidas gaseosas al por mayor, jugos envasados y agua mineral además comprará diversos productos regionales como plátano y yuca.
texts.en:
Palmira, 45, is a tenacious, obliging, very hardworking woman.  She’s divorced from the man who was her spouse for many years.  She lives in her own house with her two children who help out so that they’ll always continue forward.

Palmira’s work consists in daily sales of soft-drinks, mineral water and bottled juice of various brands and flavors.  She has a small stand located at home and she tends to customers daily there; most of them are local neighbors.  She’s been in business two years and does well.  She occasionally adds regional products like bananas, cassava root or lemons to her inventory.  Profits have been very good which is why she wants to take it on again and permanently work at both activities but they require a certain amount of capital to undertake this new stage.  She’s doing very well in the business because profits have increased thanks to the clientele she’s managed to secure over the last two years.  She’d like her income to improve still more which is why she wants to start selling regional products again thus succeeding in being her customers’ favorite seller.

This is her second MFP loan and she thanks all those people who make the loan she needs to increase he working capital possible.  She commits to be very punctual with her installment payments and she’s happy to belong to her communal bank because they are very supportive and responsible.  She will use the requested 1,200 soles to buy soft-drinks at wholesale, bottled juice and mineral water; she will also buy various regional products like bananas and cassava root.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks at wholesale, bottled juice and mineral water as well as regional items like bananas and cassava root.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio Cesar habitante de la Comarca Mata de Guineo es pequeño productor donde su principal actividad economica es el manejo de su pequeño inventario ganadero, el cuido de dichos semovientes lo realizan en su propia unidad de produccion, esta actividad se ha convertido de suma importancia para el bienestar de su familia, trabaja en conjunto con su mamá tanto en las actividades agricolas  y pecuarias.

Requiere de este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de vaquillas e incrementar su inventario y a mediano plazo poder contar con mayor produccion de leche, cuenta con buenas referencias en su localidad, por ser una persona progresiva y de buenas costumbres.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar lives in Comarca Mata de Guineo and is a small producer. His principal economic activity is managing his small inventory of cattle. Care for these livestock is accomplished in his own production facility. This activity has become very important for the well-being of his family. Julio Cesar works in conjunction with his Mother, in both his agricultural and his livestock activities.

Julio Cesar requires this financing to invest in purchasing heifers and increasing his inventory. In the medium term, he needs to be able to count on major milk production. He has good references in his locality as a progressive and respectable person.

loans.use: buy young calves to raise.

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Sinoun is 29 years old. She is married and resides with her parents and one child in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling clothes for more than seven years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed in a local organization. He earns about $7 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sinoun is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay for renting a store in the market to run a sewing shop. In addition, a part of this money is used to purchase cloth to use for sewing clothes to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to live separately from her parents.

loans.use: to pay for renting a store in the market to run a sewing shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies to manufacture hair bands.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children and her parents in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for more than ten years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her work. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) helps her run the business. 

Chantha is requesting a loan of $400 to pay for passport fees. This money will help her find a job in Thailand legally and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a rubber plantation and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to live separately from her parents.

loans.use: to pay for passport fees

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Sareth is 38 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling desserts for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. 

Sareth is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for her child’s school fees. In addition, a part of this money is used to buy a computer for her children for their studies. This money will help support her child’s study and to find a good job in the future. She hopes to expand her business and support her children to get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: Onn

texts.en:
Onn, a 30-year-old married mother of two children, resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker, while her husband (who joined her in the picture) is a carrying worker who earns about $6 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Onn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland for cultivating cassava. This will help her earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to operate a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating cassava.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is 40 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 daily.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Phan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to run a coffee shop. By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her coffee shop and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a coffee shop

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Nheb is 49 years old. She is widowed and resides with her son in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops for more than five years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her son is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day.

In order to improve her business, Nheb is requesting a loan of $1250 to purchase fertilizer to use for farming. In addition, a part of this money is used for hiring farm workers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use for farming

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Veasna is 28 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a truck driver who earns about $2 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Veasna is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to sell. This money will help her expand her store and earn more profit. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Pisey is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children and her mother in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fried shrimp and fried bananas for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband runs a horse cart and earns about $5 each day. 

Pisey is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase one more horse for her husband to use to rotate with his other one. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase another horse for her husband to use to rotate with his present one

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is 53 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than two years, earning approximately $12 per day. Her husband is involved in animal husbandry and earns about $7 each day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Yem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to sell. This money will help her expand her store and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. In addition, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 24 años, es un joven emprendedor y con muchas ganas de progresar, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos. Trabaja a diario con mucho esfuerzo para forjar su futuro y conseguir sus metas. Nuestro amigo Wilfredo se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. Tiene pequeño local que alquila en una calle muy concurrida por el público lo cual le permite tener siempre una buena clientela a quienes atiende de manera gustosa. Trabaja con ayuda de su hermana y otra persona más. Lleva en este negocio 3 años y afortunadamente las cosas están yendo por buen camino motivo por el cual se siente contento y tranquilo por todo lo que está obteniendo gracias a su trabajo. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un restaurante amplio y consolidado donde pueda vender todo el día una mayor variedad de platillos tanto amazónicos como potajes de la costa y la sierra como “ceviche” y “pachamanca” para deleitar a todos los paladares. Aunque ya ha ganado experiencia en éste trabajo siente que todavía aún le falta hacer mucho es por eso que desea seguir progresando por su bien personal y el de su familia. Este es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros a los que considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000), comprará ingredientes, insumos y un par de mesas más con sus respectivas sillas para continuar atendiendo a sus comensales y preparando los más ricos platillos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 24 years old, is a young entrepreneur who is eager to progress. He is single and lives in his parents’ house with his siblings. He works hard every day to shape his future and achieve his goals. Our friend Wilfredo sells regional foods. He rents a small store on a very busy street which allows him to always have a good clientele whom he gladly serves. He works with the help of his sister and another person. He has been in business for three years and fortunately things are going in the right direction, which is the motive for which he feels content and peaceful for everything that he is getting thanks to his work. 

For the future of his business, he hopes to have a large and consolidated restaurant where all day he can sell a larger variety of dishes, from Amazonian stews from the coast to dishes from the mountains such as “ceviche” and “pachamanca” to delight every palate. Although he has already gained experience in this work, he feels that there is still much yet to do. This is why he wishes to continue progressing for his personal well-being and that of his family. 

This is loan number 2 with MFP. He feels grateful for the financial support that he has received in order to achieve his objectives. Furthermore, he comments that he feels at ease with his communal bank since he gets along with its members, who he considers to be good people. With the amount requested (S/.1000), he will buy ingredients, supplies, and a couple of tables more with their respective chairs in order to continue serving his guests and preparing the most delicious dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, supplies, and a couple of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Beng Hon

texts.en:
Beng Hon is 60 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodle and porridge for more than ten years, earning approximately $13 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a rice farmer who earns about $2 each day. One of her children is employed in a poultry farm. He earns about $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Beng Hon is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase mobile phones and spare parts to resell. This money will help her run an additional business and earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and spare parts to resell

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 58 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing mushrooms to sell for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $2 daily. 

In order to improve her business, Kou is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more mushroom seeds to grow. This purchase will help her earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more mushroom seeds to grow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a professional camera.

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en:
Tuti is 50 years old. She is a widow and lives with her children and daughter-in-law. She has had her own business for 17 years, and it is her source of income. She sells candies, cookies, etc. 

She has not many customers right now and that’s why she decided to widen the assortment of her goods. She is asking for a loan of 3000 USD. With it she is going to buy a new variety of candies and chocolates to expand her assortment. Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of candies and chocolates for expand her assortment

loans.name: Oung

texts.en:
Oung (who is in the picture with her son) is 47 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $14 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $4 each day. 

Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Oung is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her children go to work on time. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Earm

texts.en:
Earm is 34 years old. She is married and resides with a daughter in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than four years, earning approximately $9 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 each day. Her daughter is a tailor. She earns about $2 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Earm is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more groceries to resell. This purchase will help her increase her grocery stock and earn more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is 44 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $12 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 daily. 

Oun is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase timbers to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to generate more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build a new house

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Due to the hardship of living, Renato aims to improve his farming business to generate sufficient income for his family. He is 52 years old and have seven grown-up children. Two of his children are still college age and he wants them to earn a degree so that they will become professionals someday. Despite financial difficulty, he aims to improve his hog-raising business to earn additional income. He is asking for an additional capital of P 25,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that this financial assistance will help him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Sokuntea

texts.en:
Sokunthea is 47 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for more than twenty years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her work. She is involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals. She earns about $18 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $5 daily. 

Sokunthea is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use for her farming. This purchase will help her farming business expand well. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel to use for her farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a cart for scrap selling business

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca es una persona muy trabajadora que tuvo que buscar una manera de generar ingresos para su hogar debido a que su esposo no podía cumplir con todas las obligaciones que se demandaban. Fue así como montó una venta de comidas donde puede generar ingresos para su hogar y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos, y poco a poco ir progresando con su familia. Pese al poco capital con el que cuenta, el esfuerzo constante que hace le permite superar grandes dificultades y continuar progresando en su negocio. Buscando aumentar sus ventas, Blanca busca un préstamo para comprar insumos de comidas y ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
Su sueño es poder sacar su familia adelante gracias a que sus ventas aumenten y así poder tener mejores oportunidades económicas en el hogar y mejor calidad de vida. Además, sueña con tener su local propio para ubicar el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very hard-working person.  She had to look for a way to generate income for her household because he husband was not able to meet all of their obligations.  That was how she set up food sales, where she is able to generate income for her household.  She is also able to offer her two children a better quality of life.  Her family is making progress little by little.

Despite the small amount of capital she has, her constant effort allows her to overcome big difficulties and to continue progressing in her business.  Blanca is looking to increase her sales, and she is looking for a loan in order to buy foodstuffs.  This way she will offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Her dream is to be able to get her family ahead.  Thanks to an increase in sales, she will be able to have better financial options in her home.  Her household will also have a better quality of life.  She also dreams of having her own place to locate the business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in order to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Awa  Samb's Group

texts.fr:
Le bv de Douye Sangou a été crée le 21 décembre 2009. Il est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et habitant la même localité. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Awa la vedette est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 02 filles et 06 garçons. 

Le prêt reçu lui permettra d'acheter des denrées de premières nécessités comme des détergents ( omo)à 7 500 frs l'unité, des paquets de savon à 6000 frs l'un. Elle va également acheter des moutons à revendre. 

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité, elle utilise une partie pour ses épargnes et intérêts et l'autre participe à l'amélioration de la condition de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of Douye Sangou was created on December 21st, 2009. It is made up of members who live near one another and who know each other very well socially.

Awa Samb is the leader of the group and is shown in the photo on the right, with her hand raised. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of eight children (two girls and six boys). This loan will allow her to buy staple goods, such as Omo (a brand of detergent) for 7,500 XOF per unit, and packets of soap for 6,000 XOF per unit. She will also be purchasing sheep for resale.

Awa Samb will use a portion of  the income generated by her business to invest in her savings and other interests. The rest she will use in order to improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods including Omo (a brand of detergent) and soap, as well as sheep, for resale.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie and her family have been engaged in raising swine for one year. She is a single yet hard working woman. Lailanie is a fourth-year college student taking up Hotel and Restaurant Management.

Every now and then, Lailanie finds ways to improve her swine raising business. She doubled her efforts in order to keep on producing new fatteners  and ensuring their proper growth upon reaching their maturity date for disposal.

Lailanie said that this type of business is lucrative, in the sense that it is constant and the swine that are sold are immediately replaced by new ones. Through adoption of these strategies, surely she could gain greater income to serve her family needs and to pursue her studies. To realize her goal, she is requesting additional working capital of PHP 15,000. This amount will be used to buy necessary hog feed, vitamins and vaccines. She knows that providing these livestock supplies for her swine raising business will enable her to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccine

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que padecer su familia, siempre ha seguido esforzándose para poderles ofrecer lo mejor a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Para generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar tiene un negocio de crianza y venta de ganado con el cual ha podido ir poco a poco saliendo adelante y superando las dificultades que se le presentan en la vida. Gracias a la buena calidad en sus productos que siempre lo ha caracterizado, tiene la oportunidad de tener buenos clientes que le garantizan buenas ventas, sin embargo la dificultad de capital siempre lo ha retrasado.  Por esto ahora Julio busca un préstamo para comprar 2 terneros para la crianza y así aumentar su capacidad de producción para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.
Su sueño es poder tener un mejor negocio donde pueda brindar a su familia mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante y también tener una mejor estabilidad para su familia.
texts.en: In spite of the great difficulties that his family has suffered through, Julio is a very hard-working person.  He has always continued striving to offer the best to his wife and two sons.  In order to generate income that is needed in his home, he has a business breeding and selling cattle with which he has been able to get ahead little by little, overcoming the difficulties that life presents.  Thanks to the high quality of his products that have always chararacterized him, he has the opportunity of good clients that guarantee him strong sales.  Nevertheless, the difficulty of capital has always set him back.  For this reason, Julio is now seeking a loan to buy two calves to raise and thus increase his production capacity in order to respond to his clients' orders.  His dream is to be able to have a better business so he can provide his family with better economic opportunities to get ahead, along with greater stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy two calves to breed and thus increase his production capacity in order to respond to his clients' orders.

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en: Srey Neang is 32 years old. She is married and resides with her parents and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than four years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (Tuk Tuk). He earns about $10 daily. Srey Neang is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. In the future, she would like to expand her farming and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and stock his business in order to respond to his customers’ orders and get better income.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria aprendió de su madre a fabricar arepas, y desde hace muchos años esta es la fuente de ingresos con la que contribuye económicamente en su hogar para el sostenimiento de sus 2 hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, ha podido tener buenas ventas, y a pesar de que la falta de capital hace que tenga que frenar sus ventas, ha venido creciendo poco a poco y superando esta dificultad. Con su gran esfuerzo diario ha podido sacar adelante este negocio, y ahora que tiene la oportunidad de seguir haciéndolo crecer, busca un préstamo para comprar una parrilla con mayor capacidad para poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder continuar con esta actividad y mejorar los ingresos para su familia. Además, sueña con comprarse su casa propia y ofrecer a su familia una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria was taught by her mother how to make arepas (a typical Colombian dish made of ground corn dough or cooked flour). For many years this has been the source of income with which she helps her household financially and supports her two children aged 13 and 15. Thanks to her high quality products, she's been able to make good sales. Although the lack of working capital causes her to slow down her sales, she's been gradually growing and overcoming this drawback. Through her daily hard work, she has been able to move her business forward. Now that she has the opportunity to keep on making it grow, she seeks a loan in order to purchase a larger grill so that she can meet her customers' orders. 
Her dream is to be able to keep her business going and increase her family's earnings. Besides, she dreams of buying a house of her own and providing more stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger grill so that she can meet her customers' orders.

loans.name: Denisse

texts.es: La socia es la señora Denisse, casada y con 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de cereales andinos industrializados como harinas de habas, quinua y kiwicha. Denisse en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar la materia prima como habas, quinua y kiwicha, que le permita la elaboración de sus productos. Denisse está muy agradecida con la ayuda que le proporciona KIVA, para poder fortalecerse en su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y educar a sus hijos. Denisse pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Sra. Denisse, who is married with two children. She produces industrialized Andean cereals, such as flour made from fava beans, quinoa and amaranth  At this time Denisse is requesting a loan to purchase basic materials, such as fava beans, quinoa and amaranth so that she can make her products. 

Denisse is very grateful for the help given her by KIVA so that she can strengthen her business, which enables her to offer a better quality of life to her family and to educate her children.

Denisse belongs to the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II Communal Bank in the city of Cuxco, Perú

loans.use: to purchase basic material such as fava beans, quinoa and amaranth.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Yesenia, casada y con 2 hijos, ella continua con su actividad de cosmetóloga en su salón de belleza, actividad que realiza hace algún tiempo y que le ha permitido educara a sus  hijos y proporcionar el sustento a su familia. Yesenia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar productos y accesorios de belleza como tintes y shampoo  y secadores de pelo. Yesenia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y educar a sus hijos. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: The member is Yesenia, who's married and has two children. She's still a cosmetologist at her beauty salon. She's been in this business for some time and it has allowed her to provide education for her children and support her family. Yesenia is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase beauty products and accessories such as hair dye, shampoo and hairdryers. Yesenia is very thankful for Kiva's help in strengthening her business, which allows her to improve her family's living conditions and provide education for her children. This member belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank of the town of Cusco, in Peru.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and accessories such as hair dye, shampoo and hairdryers.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Agripina, casada y con 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la comercialización de complementos alimenticios como batidos para el cuidado de la salud, actividad que le ha permitido educara a sus 2 hijos y proporcionar el sustento a su familia. Agripina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar sus complementos nutricionales como batidos y de esta manera capitalizar su actividad. Agripina está muy agradecida con la ayuda que le proporciona KIVA, para poder fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y educar a sus hijos uno de ellos en colegio y el otro en una academia pre universitaria. Agripina pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Sra. Agripina, who is married with two children. She sells food supplements, such as shakes for health care,  a business which has enabled her to educate her two children and support her family. 

At this time Agripina is requesting a loan to purchase her nutritional supplements, such as shakes and in this way she will capitalize her business.

Agripina is very grateful for the help provided by KIVA so that she can strengthen her business, which enables her to offer a better quality of life to her family and educate her children. One of her children is in primary school and the other is in a pre-university academy.

Agripina belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional supplements such as shakes.

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis
